texts.fr: La cliente Kabugho est la représentante du groupe de crédit Canane, une jeune entrepreneur, courageuse de son état, géante, encore  élancée, âgée d’une trente d’années. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un commissionnaire transporteur. La cliente en vedette est vendeuse de beignets, gâteaux, qu’elle produit avec une technologie locale. Elle a commence cette activité avec son fonds propre, alors reçu de son mari. Cependant, elle vient de bénéficier son deuxième crédit auprès de l’IMF Hekima. La cliente est plein d’espoir dans son activité. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 sac de farine, 10 kg de sucres, les levures, etc. Elle remercie l’IMF Hekima pour cette initiative de soutien à l’entreprenariat féminin. Grâce à ce crédit, elle va améliorer son capital et  subvenir aux multiples besoins de sa famille. Il sied de signer certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Kabugho is the representative of the Canane credit group.  She is a young and courageous entrepreneur.  She is about 30 years old, very tall in size and still slender.  She is married and the mother of three young children.  Her husband is a commission merchant /transporter.

Our featured borrower sells fritters and cakes, which she makes using traditional tools.  She started this activity using her own funds, received from her husband.  She has just received her second loan from the microfinance institution Hekima.  She has very high hopes for her business.

This new loan will be used to purchase one bag of flour, 10 kg of sugar, some yeast etc.  She thanks Hekima for supporting women entepreneurs.  Thanks to this loan, she will increase her capital and meet the many needs of her family.

It should be noted that (in the photo) some of the borrowers are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy one bag of flour, 10 kg of sugar, some yeast etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has been in the farming business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD, having repaid the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Joseph will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. His hope and dream is to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making siopao (steamed buns)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods to resell in her store, such as: biscuits, sugar, soap and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Hortensia Deyfilia

texts.es: La Sra. Hortensia tiene 61 años y es casada con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de 16 años, la Sra. Hortensia se dedica a la actividad del  vivero de plantas que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, y vende en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de alto Obrajes al sur de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  noveno dentro de la institución, la Sra. Hortensia va a usar este préstamo para compra de abono y semillas para plantar,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es cultivar flores de temporada para poner  a la venta, la Sra. Hortensia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son falta de espacio para diversificar  sus plantas y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar los almácigos  que es un  Plantín es el resultado de la germinación y desarrollo de una semilla botánica o de una semilla vegetativa, crecida en la celda de una bandeja en un sustrato artificial pasteurizado, transcurriendo un tiempo determinado para su trasplanté a campo definitivo según el tipo de planta, su deseo para su negocio  es ampliar el espacio, para diversificar su actividad.
texts.en: Hortensia is 61 years old and married, with one child who is 16 years old. Hortensia dedicates herself to operating a plant nursery which is located at her own home. She sells from her sales stand which is located in the upper Obrajes zone, south of the city of La Paz. This loan is her ninth with the institution, and Hortensia will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant. Her reason for requesting this loan is to cultivate seasonal flowers to offer for sale. One challenge Hortensia confronts in her business is a lack of space to diversify her plants. She will use the benefits from this loan to improve her system of seed trays, which is a method of planting resulting from the germination and development of a botanical or vegetative seed, growing in cells of a tray in a sterilized artifical substrate, over a specific period of time, in order to be transplanted to its final location in the soil, depending on the type of plant. Her desire for her business is to expand the space, so she can diversify her work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam  tiene 45  años de edad, está casada, vive con cuatro hijos y un nieto actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar productos medicinales para ganado. Ella desea mantener a sus animales (ganado), en la mejores condiciones posibles, y libres de enfermedades, paracitos, y otros, que puedan afectar la salud del animal, y así poder comercializarlos y salir adelante ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Miriam is 45 years old and married. She currently lives with four children and one grandchild. With the loan, she plans to buy medicinal products for livestock. She wants to maintain her animals (livestock) in the best possible conditions, free of diseases, parasites and other problems which may affect the animals' health. Thus, she will be able to sell them and get ahead. She does not have the necessary capital for these purchases, since she has a low level of resources and does not have a way to acquire the necessary funds for this. Thus, she requested a loan, which is the first one she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal products for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add capital and buy eggs, rice, fermented soybean, and noodles for her catering business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is a 24-year-old single man. He lives with his mother in Bayanzurkh district, Ulaanbaatar. He is a truck driver. He works in the Oyutolgoi copper mine, the largest copper mine in Mongolia. He spends 21 days working in Umnugovi Aimakh, approximately 600 km away from the city of Ulaanbaatar, and then has a 14-day weekend in UB. He and his mother live in a wooden house on their own plot of land. 

As you know, Mongolia is one of the coldest countries in the world and borders Siberia to the north. So they need to use more coal to stay warm. This is an explanation of why Mongolia is one of the worst countries for air pollution. Before the winter comes, they need to set up a heating system. He is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to buy radiators and pipes.

loans.use: to buy radiators and pipes

loans.name: Bintang Sagita Group

texts.en:
Nurhayati is a woman who sells coconut shells in one of the traditional markets in Jakarta. She has three children who attend school. Her husband works as a scavenger, distributing trash. The benefit of her job is that she can cover the household. Her major obstacle is rain, because it prevents consumers from coming to her stall. 

Nurhayati’s main goal from her job is to continue her children’s education until college. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which she will use to buy groceries for her family’s daily needs and to increase the capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy daily necessities such as sticky rice, vegetable oil, sugar, wheat flour, and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay delivery costs of online book sales, and to pay rent.

loans.name: Pavle

texts.en:
Pavle is from the Vani district of West Georgia. He is 44 years old and lives with his mother and 20-year-old son. His wife lives and works abroad to help her family financially. Pavle’s mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they own a greenhouse where they grow tomatoes, cucumbers and different kinds of greens. Pavle does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a high quality of harvest. The harvested products are sold to wholesalers. In addition, the family has a vineyard and a plot of land where they grow nuts. Pavle picks the grapes in the late summer and produces wine and vodka. In addition, he runs a small dairy farm of two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products. Pavle sells his agricultural products and cheese at the local open market.

He requested a loan to purchase greens seeds. Pavle will sow greens in his greenhouse and, after properly-done agricultural work, the family will get a quality harvest. The products will be sold for a good price. This will significantly increase the family income and Pavle will be able to reinvest the increased income in family agricultural activities. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase greens seeds to sow in his greenhouse

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Alberto sigue con la misma actividad de tienda de barrio cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que pudo surtir su tiendita con la compra de productos, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como refrescos, dulces, galletas y abarrotes para surtir su tienda, así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Alberto continues to run a neighborhood store. He says that he got on very well with the help of the previous loan as he was able to stock his small store with the products he purchased. This time he is requesting the loan to purchase products such as soft drinks, candy, cookies, and groceries to restock his store so he can offer a variety of products to his customers, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: to purchase products such as soft drinks, candy, cookies and groceries

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo, de 31 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora, es madre de una niña de 8 años a quien cría en la casa de su mamá, ella trabaja mucho pues lo que más desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su menor hija y consolidarse económicamente. Consuelo se dedica a la venta de pollos. Tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por la población, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias ya que su lugar de trabajo esta muy bien ubicado en una esquina visible de la calle, pero este trabajo merece de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar hasta los centros de abastos de pollos para adelantarse a otros vendedores que compiten en este mismo sector. Ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que su pequeña hija tiene todo lo necesario para estar cómoda. Lleva en este negocio más de 4 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso.
Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia, espera seguir trabajando para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio. Este es el préstamo grupal número 10 con MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia dentro de su grupo en donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir incrementado su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo en todos los préstamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
El monto solicitado (S/. 3500) lo invertirá en la compra de pollos de las mejores especies y tamaños.
texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Consuelo is a young, hard-working woman and is the mother of an eight-year-old girl, who she has raised in her mother's house.  She works a lot.  What she wishes for most is to be able to offer a better quality of life to her young daughter and to strengthen herself economically.   Consuelo makes a living selling chickens.  

She has a stall in one of the busiest markets.  Fortunately, she has good sales and considerable profits since her work place is well-located on a corner quite visible to the street.  But this work takes a lot of sacrifice in order to obtain good and fresh products that she offers to her customers.  She has to wake up at dawn to go to the chicken supplier to get ahead of other sellers that compete in her same area.  

She knows that all her effort is worth the difficulty and is rewarded to see that her small daughter has everything necessary to be comfortable.  She has been working in this business for more than four years.  She works alone and says that her desire to do things well and to generate economic income for her family are her main motives to go in search of further progress.

She likes the freedom that this work offers her; she can have fun during the afternoons, playing and practicing sports, and being with her family.  She hopes to continue working in order to continue growing her business.  

This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She was always a good member within her group, where they loved her for being very responsible and supportive.  She is thankful to those that have offered her the loan she requires to continue growing her business.  She is convinced that she will continue to be a very punctual client and she will pay her installments on time, like she has done with all the other loans she has had so far.

The amount she is requesting (3500 PEN) she will invest in buying more chickens of the best species and sizes.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his welding business by buying some machines

loans.name: Bintang Fajar Group

texts.en:
Neneng is a mother of four children: Agung, 17, Syawal 12, Melati, 9, and Jaka, 4. To fulfill her daily needs, she sells cigarettes and drinks on the roadside of Jakarta. She’s been doing it since four years ago. She’s married to a man who works as a driver’s assistant with Jakarta's public transportation system. From that job, he generates about IDR 30,000-50,000 per day.

Neneng loves to do her job because this is the only way that she’s able to do to afford her children’s school fees. Besides, she can work and babysit her children at the same time. Sometimes, Neneng has to deal with people who buy her merchandise on credit. 

She is now asking for a loan for  2,000,000 IDR  to increase her capital and her merchandise. With good funds and continuous hard work, her dream is to have a better job and her own restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to add capital and buy cigarettes, coffee,tea, and beverage packaging.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola, de 65 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera desde hace muchos años, tiene 2 hijos y vive junto a ellos más un nieto en su casa propia luchando por salir adelante.
El trabajo de Lola consiste en la venta de abarrotes, tiene su pequeño negocio instalado en su casa, se dedica a tiempo completo a cumplir esta función y se siente muy contenta por sus ventas. Trabaja sola mientras realiza algunas funciones básicas en su hogar. Abastece su negocio de manera semanal comprando en los centros comerciales del centro de la ciudad con la ayuda de su hijo. Lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace 5 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que produce sus ingresos económicos sin que esto le demande un excesivo esfuerzo, además tiene tiempo para poder ayudar a su pequeño nieto con sus tareas escolares. Le esta yendo bien ya que tiene buenos ingresos que le permiten pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, espera poder ampliar su negocio y empezar a ahorrar para invertir en un futuro en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Este es el crédito grupal número 19 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas como lo hizo en los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer a su grupo de trabajo ya que todos sus miembros son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
El monto solicitado (S/. 3000) lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de abarrotes como 1 saco de arroz, azúcar, 5 cajas de leche chica, pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina, galletas, conservas de atún, embutidos y otros productos.
texts.en:
Lola, 65, is a very hardworking woman. She has been single for many years and has two children with whom she lives along with a grandson, in her own home, fighting to get ahead. 

Lola's work is in grocery sales. She has her small business set up in her own home. She devotes herself full-time to carrying out this function and is quite satisfied with her sales. She works alone while also taking care of basic tasks in her home. She stocks her business on a weekly basis, making her purchases in the downtown shopping centers of the city with the help of her son. She has been doing this work for five years. What she likes about her work is that she produces financial income without this demanding an excessive effort from her. Additionally she has time to be able to help her little grandson with his homework from school. It's going well for her since she has good earnings that allow her to make her payments on time. 

She hopes to be able to expand her business and start to save up in order to invest in some improvements to her living conditions in the future. This is the 19th group loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support so she can keep increasing her working capital. She is also sure  she will keep on being the same timely and responsible member when it comes to making payments as she has been in the previously acquired loans. She is glad to belong to her work group since all the members are responsible and mutually supportive. 

She will invest the entire amount requested of 3,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of groceries such as a bag of rice, sugar, five boxes of milk packaged in small cartons, bread, eggs, oil, bananas, onions, flour, cookies, canned tuna, sausage and other products.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of rice, sugar, five boxes of milk packaged in small cartons, bread, eggs, oil, bananas, onions, flour, cookies, canned tuna, sausage and other products.

loans.name: Bintang Vega Group

texts.en:
For the past 2 years, Ummul has operated a grocery stall business at her house. Many people usually come to her stall at the beginning of the month. The business proceeds cover household expenses and her children’s school fees. Ummul’s husband works as a private sector employee.

Ummul loves her business because she can easily take care of her children. Her major obstacles are the number of competitors, the rising prices of groceries and the consumers who owe money. In order to continue improving her grocery stall, Ummul is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR to buy grocery needs such as oil, rice, granulated sugar, wheat flour, etc. Ummul also hopes that she can have her own house because she’s living at her parents’ house now.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, granulated sugar, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years and her husband works as a fisherman. Ederlina works hard to support her husband in meeting the family's needs, especially for their children's schooling.

Ederlina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other items. With these purchases, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Ederlina hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other items

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 34-year-old married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has two children, aged 9 and 4 years old. For the past 5 years, Marilou has owned a sari-sari (variety) store business, selling commodities such as soft drinks, sugar, coffee and canned goods. Her husband is a farmer.

Marilou has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional merchandise such as soft drinks, sugar, coffee and canned goods. She would like to expand her business by investing in other ventures to support her family and to save for her children's education, for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy  soft drinks, sugar, coffee and canned goods

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther, de 52 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable, es soltera pero es madre de 4 hijos, ella vive en su casa propia a lado de 2 de ellos además de su yerno y su nieto, lucha diariamente para sostener a su familia y brindarles todo lo que necesitan. 
El trabajo de Esther consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, tiene un taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo hace 20 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió trabajando desde joven, poco a poco y con mucha paciencia fue conociendo sobre técnicas de costura y decidió generar sus propios ingresos poniendo en práctica lo que mejor sabe hacer. Adicionalmente ha incursionado en el negocio de la compra y venta de maderas debido a la rentabilidad que este sector laboral genera, trabaja con el apoyo de su yerno quien conoce del desarrollo de esta actividad mejor que ella. Mientras tanto, durante el tiempo que está dedicada a su trabajo de costura siempre ha buscado la mejor forma para realizar su labor ya que muchas veces la presión de sus clientes le hizo sentir que no iba a poder cumplir eficientemente su función, sin embargo le hizo frente a las adversidades y actualmente tiene planes de expansión para su negocio, pero sabe que el camino para lograrlo es largo y por el momento desea mantenerlo como una meta a largo plazo, ahora se preparará para empezar a confeccionar sus propios diseños y venderlos ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes. Este es el crédito individual numero 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además esta muy decidida a cumplir una vez más con sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho ser cliente de la institución ya que le brindan todo el apoyo necesario para seguir adelante. 
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000), implementará su taller de costura comprando telas, agujas, hilos y otros accesorios que necesita para continuar con su trabajo de confecciones.
texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old. She is a good and very responsible woman who is the mother of 4 children. she lives in a home she owns with two of them as well as a son in law and a grandson. She fights every day to support her family and offer them everything they need. 

Esther's job is cutting and sewing clothing. She has a workshop in her house and has been doing this work for 20 years. everything she knows she learned from working since she was very young. Little by little and with a lot of patience she learned about the techniques of sewing and decided to generate her own income but putting into practice what she knew how to do best. She also has entered into the business of buying and selling lumber due to the profitability that that sector generates. She works with her son in law's help. He knows about the development of this activity more than she does. Meanwhile. during the time that she does her sewing work she is always working for the best way to do the work since many times the pressure from the customers made her feel like she wasn't going to be able to complete her tasks efficiently. Nonetheless, she faces the adversity and now she has plans to expand her business. She knows that the way to do it is long and at this time she wants to keep it as a long term goal. Now she will prepare to sew her own designs and sell them, since she already has orders from her customers. This is her third individual loan with the MFP institution. She is grateful to all of the people who are making her loan possible so she can continue with her programmed objectives and growth. She is also very determined to make her payments on time once again as she did so far with her other loans. She really likes being a client of the institution since they offer her all of the support she needs to keep getting ahead.

With the amount of (S/. 2000) she has asked for, she will outfir her sewing workshop by buying fabrics, needles, thread and other accessories she needs to continue with her work making clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, thread and other accesories she needs for her work sewing clothes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia tiene 42 años, tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 20,17 y 12 años  se dedica  a la venta de distintos materiales y herramientas en su ferretería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona Germán Buch, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,   con el dinero del crédito comprara  variedad de herramientas como desarmadores, martillos, mangueras, cables, etc.  Por mayor para surtir su ferretería y así brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes, la Sra. Lucia  se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brinda para crecer en su negocio ya que sigue surtiendo su ferreteria y de esta manera genera más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Lucia is forty-two and has three children, who are twenty, seventeen, and twelve.  She makes a living selling various materials and tools in her hardware store, which is located in the Germán Buch area.  This is her first loan with Emprender.  She will use the money to buy a variety of tools wholesale, like screwdrivers, hammers, hoses, cables, etc to stock her hardware store and to offer her customers a variety of products.  Lucia is very thankful for the opportunity being given to her to grow in her business.  She will keep stocking her hardware store, and in this way, she will generate more income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools wholesale.

loans.name: Lkham

texts.en:
Mrs. Lkham, a 60-year-old widow, lives alone in a small ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar. With her children’s help and support, she keeps operating her business. Lkham has previously taken out two loans and has recently repaid the last one, never missing a due date, which shows how she is active, hardworking and responsible. Lkham is very thankful to Kiva lenders for helping to expand her business and improving her and her children’s living conditions.

Since Lkham has been cooperating with Kiva, lots of improvements have occurred in her life, such as her building a new house for her children. Every time she takes out a loan, the amount increases noticeably, which shows that her business’s working capital is also increasing.This increase in business definitely has changed Lkham's life. She is now requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more wooden materials since the price of these materials is at its lowest point at this period of time. She will use these materials to produce furniture in the spring and summer.

loans.use: to buy more wooden materials to produce furniture

loans.name: Road To Success Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from the members of the "Road To Success" group. Mohamed and Osman are pleased to inform you that their previous Kiva loan has been very helpful to their businesses and personal lives. The loan helped to improve their businesses both in terms of size and quality. This led to increases in sales and profit margins.

Having repaid that loan successfully, they are again applying for a new loan of 3,400,000 SLL to further expand their respective businesses. Featured leader Mohamed will again use his share of the loan to buy more bales of used bags to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used bags to add to his stall

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene 58 años de edad,vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Herminio es a la venta de embutidos y anticuchos en las afueras del mercado de Cayaltí, por ser un lugar muy transitado y vender productos de calidad sus ventas aumentarán, al igual que su clientela.

El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Kiva y le ha ido bastante bien, por ello se encuentra acudiendo por un nuevo crédito que le permita seguir desarrollando su negocio. Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a adquirir mayor mercadería en embutidos.

Herminio es una persona empeñosa y responsable que desea que su negocio crezca para brindarle un nivel de vida mejor a su esposa. El agradece de antemano el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Herminio is fifty-eight and lives with his wife in his own home.  He has indoor plumbing and electricity.  His house is located in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo.  In this area, agriculture and livestock are practiced.  Herminio sells sausages and kebabs on the outskirts of the Cayaltí market, in a very frequented place.  If he sells high-quality products, his sales will increase along with his customers.  He has worked previously with Kiva and it has gone rather well for him.  This is why he is turning to them for a new loan that will let him continue developing his business.  Currently, he is requesting a loan for 1,500 PEN that will help him acquire better sausages.  Herminio is a hard-working and responsible person who hopes that his business grows so that he can offer a better quality of life to his wife.  He is thankful in advance for the support offered to him.

loans.use: to buy sausages to expand his business.

loans.name: Tunagurane Group

texts.fr:
Salvator fait partie du groupe Tunagurane et habite à Gitega. Il a 44 ans et est mariée à Joséphine commerçante de beignets. Ensemble ils ont  8 enfants, le cadet  est à l’école primaire,l’aîné étudie à l’école secondaire

Il fait le commerce de restaurant depuis    6 ans.

C’est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et acheter des  produits vivriers (haricot, patate douce, huile de palme,…) à revendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus.

Grâce au gain de son commerce, il assure les frais de santé, il achète les habits, et de la nourriture de la famille. Il a déjà acheté  une chèvre.
texts.en:
Salvator is part of the Tunagurane group and lives in Gitega. He is 44 years old and married to Josephine, a beignet seller. Together they have eight children. The youngest is in primary school and the oldest is in secondary school,

He has worked in the restaurant business of six years.

This is his first loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy food products (beans, sweet potatoes, palm oil) to cook and resell in his restaurant, to earn more.

Thanks to the gains from his business, he provides for his family's health costs and buys their clothing and food. He has already purchased a goat.

loans.use: buy food products (beans, sweet potatoes, palm oil) to cook and resell in his restaurant.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children, who attend school. Habib has worked as a van driver since 2000, transporting students to their desired locations. He is a trustful and kind man. Habib has been able to attract a wide range of clients in a short period of time. In order to afford the high costs of living and meeting his family's needs, Habib has been obliged to work continually.

Habib is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his van in order to make his transportation easier and safer. Habib wishes to earn a higher income and to better support his family. In the future, he plans to replace his van with a bigger one which will certainly increase his returns.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his van

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab, 25 years old, is a friendly young woman. She got married a few years ago and has one child. Zeinab is really proud of her family and is ready to do her best to be able to offer them a respectable life. Since their marriage, Zeinab’s husband has managed the family expenses. However, since Zeinab noticed that their income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own clothing shop with the small amount of money she already had.

Zeinab sells a wide variety of clothes, earning a fair amount of money daily. To better develop her work, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the new winter collection (pants, t-shirts and many other items) for her shop. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter collection for her shop

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus 02 hijos de edad escolar en casa familiar, situada en uno de los caseríos que conforman el área rural del distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito dedicado al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Se dedica a la preparación de alimentos y bebidas para venta a trabajadores de empresas agrícolas de la zona. Este negocio cuenta con bastante acogida ya que la mayoría de trabajadores de esas empresas no son de la zona y no pueden regresar a sus casas a consumir sus alimentos a la hora de su receso. Paralelamente cría aves de corral y ganado vacuno en la zona donde reside. 

José Luis desea incursionar en la comercialización del excremento de los animales que cría para usos agrícolas (en la zona son utilizados como fertilizantes). Para ello ha solicitado un crédito de 2200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de envases y personal con el cual pueda recoger el excremento de sus corrales y envasarlo antes de su comercialización.

José Luis espera que con este negocio pueda incrementar sus ingresos y poder sacarlos adelantes a su familia. El agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Luis is a 30-year-old father who lives with his wife and two school-aged children in a family member's home, located in one of the hamlets that make up the rural area of the District of Cayalti, a district dedicated to commerce, crop farming and animal husbandry. 

He earns a living preparing food and drink to sell to workers in the farming enterprises in the area. This business is quite well-attended since the majority of workers in those enterprises are not from the area and cannot return home to consume their meals during break times. At the same time he raises poultry and sheep in the area where he resides. 

José Luis wishes to venture into the commercialization of the excrement produced by the animals he raises for agricultural uses (it is used as fertilizer in the region). For this purpose he has requested a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that he plans to invest in the purchase of containers and the hiring of workers to gather up the excrement from his animal pens and package it prior to sale. 

José Luis hopes that, with this business, he is able to increase his earnings and so get his family ahead. He appreciates in advance the persons who support him in reaching his goal.

loans.use: to purchase containers and hire workers to gather up the excrement from his animal pens and package it prior to sale.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia, 21 years old, lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Sylivia has been working hard to manage her small vegetable vending business.

To help expand her business, Sylivia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more vegetables to sell. The loan will help Sylivia to generate greater profits and to use them to pay for her child's tuition. Sylivia hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build herself a home. 

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. She has three children and has been doing this work for four years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, job salary, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Apart from providing food for the family, it provides income too." She describes her biggest challenge: "During planting season the price of inputs is high." Animals on the farm have been given the names of Grace and Serey. She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Maria was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "It is the only microfinance institution providing asset finance to farmers in my area." This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. She replied, "To invest productive assets."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Maria replied, "Through the acquisition of another dairy cow, the family's milk production will be boosted, hence higher income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Maria owns the following: cow, poultry, and bicycle. She does not own pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD player, but does not have solar power or sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo y su esposa Celia se dedican desde hace casi 40 años a la producción de café. Ellos tienen 5 hijos que también se dedican a esta actividad, aunque ya por su cuenta pues ya son casados. Ricardo aprendió todo lo relacionado con la producción de café desde que tenía 12 años al lado de su padre. Para la siguiente cosecha Ricardo y su esposa necesitan un crédito para pagar a los cortadores de café que contratarán para trabajar en sus fincas. Después de la cosecha Ricardo iniciará un vivero de planta de café la cual utilizará para sembrar en sus fincas y también para vender a productores de la región. Además de la producción de café Ricardo es taxista desde hace 20 años, actividad que le ha ayudado a tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo and his wife Celia have earned a living as coffee growers for 40 years. They have five children who also devote themselves to this business though they work for themselves now that they are married. Ricardo learned everything related to coffee production since the age of 12, alongside his father. 

For the next harvest Ricardo and his wife need a loan to pay the coffee harvesters whom they will hire to work in their fields. After the harvest Ricardo will start up a greenhouse for coffee seedlings which he will use to sow his fields and also for selling to producers in the region. In addition to growing coffee Ricardo is a taxi driver which he has done for 20 years, a business that has helped him make better earnings for his family.

loans.use: to pay coffee harvesters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help his cattle

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Como toda madre que quiere lo mejor para sus hijos, no les importa el valor del sacrificio, por eso con solo el hecho de ser madres son bendecidas por Dios, la señora María es una de ellas, que con sueños bien arraigados está apoyando académica mente a su hijo; Al  que con el fruto de sus esfuerzos, logre graduarse a nivel profesional.

 Es casada, y está solicitando un crédito a ceprodel para pagarle los modulos universitario a su hijo, ya que le agradece por ser uno  de los organismos que apoya las causas justas de las necesidades de sectores de escasos recursos, por eso merece al apoyo para solucionar tan noble causa, tan importante para el Desarrollo personal, social y económico, en el mejoramiento de las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Like every mother who wants the best for her children, who doesn't concern herself with the value of her sacrifices, who for the simple fact of being a mother is graced by God, so is Señora María.  With very deeply-rooted dreams, she is providing her son with support in his education.  She hopes that the fruit of his efforts is graduating and starting a career. 

Señora María is married and is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to pay for one of her son's university courses.  She thanks Ceprodel for being one of the organizations that supports the just causes of the low-income sector and provides the support needed for such a noble cause.  Personal, social and economic development are so important in improving one's condition and quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university courses.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 52-year-old a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Maria, a business lady, and they are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully. David will use the money to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profits from the business he will educate his children. His dream is to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 32 year old businessman. He is married to Alice, a business lady, and they are blessed with one child.  He has been running a spare parts business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 3,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. James will use the loan to buy more spare parts to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and improve the family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy wheels, oil, and spanners to add to his stock.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Umu from Torkpoi town Bo, Southern area of Sierra Leone. She is a mother with 4 children between the ages of 5 years and 13 years.

Umu operate a clothing business, she sells buckets, baskets, and clothing material . She has been operating this business for the past 5 years. Umu has been working hard to manage her business. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week.  

Umu has requested a loan of Le 900,000 in order to buy more general stock like buckets, baskets, and fabric for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she plans to improve her family's living condition. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more general stock like buckets, baskets, and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE – 26 está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales sinco son mujeres y tres varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Ana tiene 28 años,  tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,   se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Communal bank AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE – 26 is made up of eight members, five female and three male, that make a living through various activities. The bank's president is Ana. She is 28, has two school-aged children and sells catalogue cosmetics. She does this in an itinerant way, offering her products door-to-door at homes and private and public institutions in La Paz. This will be her first cycle with our institution and she plans to use her loan to purchase discounted wholesale cosmetics and jewelry, aiming at offering a greater diversity to her customers and thus increasing her profits. She is asking for this loan because she wants to improve her business and will use the profits for buying more beauty products. Ana is a hard-working woman who feels very grateful for this opportunity as it is her only means for supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale cosmetic products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 54 year old married woman and a mother of six children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari store for several years now, selling various goods to the people in the community. Carmelita wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, soap, shampoo and other things. Through this, she will be able to attract more customers to her store, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, soap, shampoo and other things

loans.name: Florindo

texts.es: Florindo tiene 76  años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo, y vive con su familia actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar  ganado y darle asistencia a este. El desea invertir en la compra de una vaca,y mantenerla en la mejores condiciones posibles por medio de productos especiales para este tipo de animal, para mantenerlos  libres de enfermedades, paracitos, y otros, que puedan afectar la salud del animal, y asi luego poder ser comercializada, y poder obtener ingresos para su humilde hogar  ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante. El  no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Florindo is 76 years old. He is married and has a son. He lives with his family at present. With this loan, he expects to buy and raise cattle. His goal is to purchase a cow and keep it in the best possible condition, using specialized products for avoiding disease, parasite and other threats to the animal's health in order to sell it later on and gain some income for his humble family, which is dependent upon this enterprise. Since he is a poor man, he lacks the resources needed for making this purchase on his own. That is how he asked FUDECOSUR for a loan. In the past, he hasn't received any loans from public banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him a more accesible loan with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase and raise cattle

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a thirty two year old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for two years and works twelve hours a day. With the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and restock her business. Inadequate capital is her major challenge while her desire is to educate children and expand her business to new markets. Juliet is requesting a loan to buy toys and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy  toys and clothes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old. He lives in Baghdati district, West Georgia with his 37-year-old wife and 2 children (8 and 7 years old). The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a hectare of land where maize and nut-trees are grown. They also have a bakery and bake traditional Georgian bread. Besides, David has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese, nuts, maize and bread in their village at a good price. David is very hard working and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan to purchase wood and flour for baking bread. After supplying additional stock of flour and wood, they will be able to bake and sell more bread. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. David awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase wood and flour for baking bread

loans.name: Gathoni

texts.en:
Gathoni is a sixty-four-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband. All her children have finished schooling. She has been in farming for the past twenty years producing milk, maize, and horticultural crops which she sells to the people around her local area.

She is requesting for 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will help her get more income which in turn will help her change her standards of living. She hopes to adopt modern dairy farming techniques in the next five years.

High costs of production and animal feeds are her major challenges in farming.

Gathoni is very greatful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en: Asaad is a 43-year-old married man and a father of 3 children. He owns a grocery store, which has been the only source of income for the family since 1997. He is well-known for his good morals and nice treatment of customers. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy special-offer products, in order to keep on pleasing his customers. Asaad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for 18 consecutive cycles, which have had a clear effect on his business development. Through this loan, Assad will be able to increase his profits by adding new products. He is always looking forward to expanding his store more and more.

loans.use: to buy special-offer products

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Fatmata from Torkpoi town Bo, Southern area. She is a married mother with 1 child aged 21 years, who is currently attending school. She began this business because she needed to raise income for the growth of her family.

To earn a living, Fatmata operates a food stand business within her neighborhood. She sells palm oil, rice, and pepper. She has been operating this business for the past 15 years. She works at the business 9 hours per day and 7 days per week. 

She is seeking her first loan, in the amount of Le 800000, so that she can purchase more food like palm oil, rice, and pepper for resale. The anticipated profit she expects to generate from the loan will be used to pay school fees for her child. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to own a residential plot of land. 

Fatmata thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more food like palm oil, rice, and pepper for resale.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es:
Floriana de 41 años, es una madre muy abnegada y responsable, tiene a su pequeño retoño Marco de 5 añitos en quien invierte todo su amor y trabajo, su pareja Filomeno es su apoyo incondicional de toda la vida. Juntos habitan en una casa hecha de madera cuyos planes a futuro es construirla a base de material noble. Debido a un mal momento económico que vivía  decidió cambiar de rubro. Ingresando a la selva central y aprovechando las parcelas que le dejó sus padres, logró cultivar café y que con ayuda de sus esposo, pudo consolidar su trabajo. Una de las cosas que le agradan con respecto a su actividad es notar que sus parcelas cada vez son mas productivas, pues los granos de café son bien cotizados por los acopiadores a quien ella destina sus productos. No obstante los factores en contra al que tiene que afrontar son el tema del transporte debido a que debe contar con estibadores en un gran número para trasladar los granos secos al borde de la carretera para su posterior traslado a la ciudad.
Durante la época donde se inicia la época de mantenimiento tiene planeado brindar toda la atención del caso a sus plantaciones de café de manera que planea contratar a jornaleros para el sembrado y abono correspondiente de las plantas, adicional a ello desea remover una parte de su terreno para reforzar la productividad.
A futuro planea comprar un terreno adicional para ampliar la producción y por consiguiente las ganancias.
Este es su octavo crédito para el cual siempre mostró una buena conducta crediticia con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, manifiesta estar muy contenta con su grupo ya que siempre fueron claros y muy puntuales en sus pagos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado para la contrata de jornaleros y la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Floriana, 41, is a dedicated and responsible mother. She devotes all her love and effort to her 5 year old son, Marco. Her partner, Filomeno, has been her unconditional, life-long support. They live in a wooden house where they plan to lay concrete in the future. Because of a bad moment she went through once, she decided to seek for a economic activity. She moved to the jungle and, using a lot inherited from her parents, she was able to grow coffee and consolidate her business with her husband's support. One of her favorite things about her activity is to see how her lots become increasingly productive and how the coffee beans are well paid by the buyers in bulk to which she sells her products. However, she faces obstacles regarding transportation and needs to hire a large amount of carriers to help her take the dried beans to the side of the road for its subsequent transportation to the city.
During the growing season, she plans to cater to her coffee plantations in every possible way, hiring day laborers for planting and fertilizing coffee. She also wants to till part of her lot in order to reinforce productivity. 
Her plans for the future are to buy another plot to increase production and also profits. 
This will be Floriana's eighth loan. She has always been very punctual with her payments and is very satisfied with he group because they have always been clear and payed on time.
With the 1,000 new Soles requested, Floriana will complete the money she needs to hire day laborers and will purchase organic fertilizer for her coffee plantations.

loans.use: To hire day laborers and buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 4 years, Allen has been working hard to manage her clothes store and a tailoring business, which makes and sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and expand her business, and will help Allen to generate greater profits. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and expand her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 4 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET, LTD. after repaying the previous loan successfully. She used the previous loan to buy more stock of clothes to add to her business. Mary will use this loan to add more stock of second-hand clothes to sell in the coming high season.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to add to her business.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en: Victoire is 25 years old. She is married and has one child aged 1. She sells used shoes and has requested a loan to buy more used shoes for sale. She plans to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Olga Vanessa

texts.es:
Olga es originaria de Estelí, soltera, madre de dos hijos, de oficio comerciante. Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo en un kiosco de  gaseosa, además de  vender eso, también vendía refresco, enchilada y luego con los ahorros que recogió decidió poner su pulpería  para obtener  mayores ganancias.
Olga solicita  el crédito para invertir más en el negocio y poder comprar más  producto como gaseosa, jugo, carnes, pan y repostería, de esta manera hacer crecer el negocio
Su sueño es  poder  llegar a tener un comedor   y una pulpería más grande  de esta manera poder ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is originally from Estelí. She is single, the mother of two children, and works as a shopkeeper. She began her business selling soft drinks in a kiosk. In addition to this, she also sold refreshments and enchiladas, and then, with the savings that she collected, she decided to set up her grocery store to obtain greater earnings.

Olga is applying for the loan to invest more in her business and be able to buy more products such as soft drinks, juice, meats, bread, and pastries. In this way she will make her business grow. 

Her goal is to be able to have a dining area and a bigger grocery store, and in this way she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juice, meats, bread, and pastries to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 67-year-old farmer in Kitale where she lives with her husband since all her children have finished schooling. Her children are between the ages of 50 to 30 years old. 

Esther has been farming for over 20 years producing poultry products, milk, maize, and horticultural crops, which she sells locally. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. After selling these products, she will earn more income, which  will help her uplift her standards of living. She aspires to specialize in poultry and dairy farming to serve a wider market in the next 5 years.

Unreliable rain and fluctuation of market prices are her major challenges in farming.

Esther is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for offering her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paulina Santusa

texts.es: La Sra. Paulina  tiene 40 años y casado  con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  12 y 6 años, ella se dedica a  servicio costura de enaguas para las cholitas son como faldas delgadas que las mujeres usan debajo su pollera , en su taller propio que se encuentran en zona Santiago Segundo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Paulina  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de variedad de telas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere mejorar la calidad del trabajo realizado ya que tiene pedidos que entregar a distintos mercados ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la Sra. Paulina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de maquinas de coser y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de maquinas, La Sra. Paulina es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en: Señora Paulins is 40 years old. She is married and has two sons, ages 12 and 6. Her work is sewing petticoats for the indigenous women. They are like thin skirts that the women use underneath their skirts. She has her own workshop in the Santiago Segundo zone. This is her first loan with this institution. Señora Paulina is going to use the loan to buy a variety of fabrics. Her reason for applying for this loan is that she wants to improve the quality of the work she does, since she has orders to deliver to different markets, since at this time of year there is much demand. Señora Pauling faces challenges in her business, which are the lack of sewing machines and at times of material, when they give her wholesale orders, depending on the work that she has to do. She is going to use her earnings to buy machines. Señora Paulina is a hard-working person whose desire is to have a big workshop and contract hand work and thus teach young people the trade of making clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make petticoats.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 41-year-old enterprising business lady who is married to her husband, Thomas. They both distribute timber and this has been their business for the past 3 years. They earn a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Monica is applying for her fifth loan term from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans. She used the previous loan to buy a power saw for cutting down timber. Monica will use this loan to buy more trees for timber.

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will buy another power saw.  Her hopes and dreams are to expand her timber business, to buy a piece of land, and to build rental houses to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more trees for timber.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 36-year-old single Lebanese woman living with her parents and only one working sibling. 

In 2004, Nisrine started running her own shop selling accessories and souvenirs. She has a wide variety of home accessories, perfumes, and many other items. Her income is really essential to help her father with the family’s household expenses. Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges that the Lebanese woman faces in running a business while at the same supporting her family. This is the reason of why she is asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory of perfumes, accessories, and souvenirs. Her intention is to augment her sales and amplify her income as well. She dreams of having her own family and children.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of perfumes, accessories, and souvenirs.

loans.name: Sara Leyda

texts.es:
Sara  tiene  42 años es originaria de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, casada, madre de dos hijos, los cuales estudian la primaria. Ella inicio su negocio a la edad de 33 años fue, vendiendo caramelos y snacks así fue incrementando sus ventas, su esposo la ha apoyado desde el principio. Actualmente se dedica a vender   sus productos  en su casa, pero  a ella le gustaría ampliar más su negocio en la misma ciudad.
 Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir más en su negocio y asi poder comprar más  granos básicos  como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc. de esta manera  poder ofrecer mas productos a mis clientes y poder satisfacer sus necesidades y asi obtener un nuevo ingresos para poder comprar una refrigeradora y  poder ampliar su pulpería con venta de productos lácteos, jugos y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Sara is 42 years old. She is originally from Estelí. She is a shopkeeper, is married, and is the mother of two children, who are in primary school. She began her business at the age of 33, selling candies and snacks, and then increasing her sales. Her husband has supported her from the beginning. Now she sells her products in her home, but she would like to expand her business in the same city.

She is applying for the loan so that she can invest more in her business by being able to buy more basic foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc. In this way she will be able to offer more products to her customers and satisfy their needs and thus obtain new income so that she can buy a refrigerator and expand her business with the sale of dairy products, juices, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc, for her store

loans.name: Kayirsa

texts.ru: Кайырса со своей семьей живет в одном из высокогорных сел Кыргызстана – селе Эмгекчил,что что на севере страны. Ей 43 года, воспитывает 5 детей. Кайырса в качестве источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)в 1989 году на сегодняшний день хозяйство насчитывает  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 голов овец, 1 лошадь, и приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайырса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 быков на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Кайырса планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства и на образование детей. В своей жизни для нее самыми важными являются дети. Вырастить детей и дать им образование это цель ради которой она работает.
texts.en: Kayirsa and her family live in Emgekchil, one of the mountain villages of Kyrgystan, in the north of the country. She is 43 years old and bringing up five children. Kayirsa raises livestock, which is the main source of income for her family.  Her farm, launched in 1989 with the initial capital of 15,000 KGS, now includes two dairy cows with their young, 10 sheep, one horse; sales of milk and dairy products bring in   about 5,000 KGS per month. In order to develop her business further, Kayirsa has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy bulls for fattening and resale. Kayirsa plans to use her revenues to expand her farm and  provide for her children’s education. Her children are the most important thing in her life. She works for the sake of bringing up and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers (70 kg) and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of food stuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil, and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Cam

texts.en:
Cam is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda, in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Cam has been working hard to manage his retail store, which sells posho, sugar and drinks. 

To help expand his business, Cam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stocks of sugar, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell in his store, allowing him to generate greater profits and have everything he needs for sale. Cam hopes that in the future he will be able to grow the business. 

Cam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell in his store.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo runs a sari-sari, or variety store, in his own place in San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the business for more than 10 years now, selling various goods like bread, biscuits, noodles, and canned goods.

Romeo is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell in his store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap, and shampoo.
In the future, Romeo hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Aminata from Torkpoi town, Bo, in Sierra Leone's Southern Province. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 10 and 20. Both are going to school.

Aminata runs a food business at her house. She has been running this business for the past 11 years. She works at the business every day, starting at 4 a.m., and she does not rest until she comes back from the market to prepare food for the next day. Her business is her only source of income. She says cooking is the best business for her because she can feed herself and her family.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to expand her shop by buying bags of rice, cooking oil and seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and improve her living conditions. In the future, she plans to send her children to university. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to expand her cookery shop by buying bag rice, cooking oil and cooking season

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Alice has been working hard to manage her fast food business, which sells fast food like chips. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase Irish potatoes, fish, and other things needed for the business, and it will help Alice to generate greater profits and cater for her family. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to be a powerful business lady. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, fish and other things needed for the business

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is a 28 year old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol, and the father of a 1 year old child. He is engaged in seaweed farming, and also fishes as a source of income. He sells his fish and seaweed, and earns 5,400 pesos a month from the two businesses. He has requested a loan of 5,000 pesos to purchase additional seaweed, fishing nets and wood. In the future, Alejandro would like to expand his business activities by investing in other ventures to support his family and maintain a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy  seaweed, wood, fishing nets, and wood

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children.

In 1990, Mounir started his own business as a fisherman. It was a hobby that turned into a profession, which can return on him with higher revenue. In parallel, he works as a farmer; his job consists of cultivating vegetables. He takes good care of the land and always seeks to diversify the harvests to be able to satisfy his clients' needs.

Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new, bigger fishing nets. He states that the loan will help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage, which will certainly enhance his way of living. In the future, he plans to open his own fishery.

loans.use: to purchase new, bigger fishing nets.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 32 years old. He sells clothes and has been selling clothes for one year. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is a 30-year-old married woman with two children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for four years and also farms for another source of income. Like most farmers, she is challenged by unpredictable weather changes. Also, she receives low pay as a teacher. Her dream is to have a good house and venture into modern farming methods. She also wants to educate her children up to the university. Bridget is requesting for a loan to pay workers to renovate her house and buy the necessary materials.

loans.use: to pay workers to renovate her house and buy the necessary materials.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is 31 years old. He has been a businessman for the past five years, selling shoes. He wants the loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 41 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past five years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, maize flour and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more retail stock such as sugar and soap, and will help Robert generate greater profits and increase his stock for more profits. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his business sales. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more retail stock, such as sugar and soap.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a seaweed farming business together for more than 20 years now.
Leonila is asking for a loan to buy seaweed farming materials such as straw, seaweed seedlings and rope.
Through this, she will be able to augment their seaweed production.
In the future, Leonila dreams of expanding their livelihood and exploring another venture to augment their income.

loans.use: to buy seaweed farming materials such as straw, seaweed seedlings and rope.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 40 year old married woman. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables on a truck around the neighborhood. On the other hand, Maryam prepares a variety of vegetables and packs them to be ready for cooking. She sells the packages either by herself or through her husband. She also sells  items of clothing at home as secondary work. She has applied for this loan to get more packaging material for vegetables and to invest in her clothing sales business to bring in more clothes for a winter collection.

loans.use: to buy more packaging material

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto de treinta y cinco de edad  vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; El se dedica a realizar trabajos en metal y lamina, fabrica defensas para ventanas, puertas, portones, enrejado entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad por lo que ya tiene clientela fija que lo prefiere por los buenos precios, la calidad y el servicio excelente; Mario es un hombre dedicado a su labor y a toda su familia son las dos cosas mas importantes en su vida, se esfuerza todos los días por ofrecerles un futuro mejor y una vida digna, esta pendiente de todo lo que necesitan, en los últimos meses la casa ha tenido deterioros y necesita reparaciones para seguridad y comodidad de los que la habitan, pero Mario no cuenta con el suficiente capital que la respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, cemento, piso, herramientas etc., Mario Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto is 35 years old and lives with his life partner in a house they own. He works with metal and sheets, manufactures protection for windows, doors, gates, and railings, among others. He has been in the business for several years and has a lot of experience with sales. He is located in his home and is well known for the local people, thus he has regular clients who prefer him for the good prices, quality and excellent service. 

Mario is a man dedicated to his job and to his family; they are the two most important things in his life. He strives every day in order to offer them a better future and a dignified life. He is always aware of what they need. 

In the last months, the house has had some damage that needs to be fixed for safety and comfort of those who live in it. However, Mario doesn't have enough capital to support it, so he decided to apply for a loan to INTEGRAL to buy tiles, cement, floors, tools, etc. 

Mario Ernesto has good payment references and is very responsible. He ensures que will repay the debt in the time established. At the same time, he also hopes to offer to his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, floor, and tools.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a married Lebanese man. He’s 33 years old. He’s really attached to his wife and child. Cooperating together, Ali and his wife were able to cover their heavy life expenses in order to live a respectable life. Ali started his business at an early age. He had to work with professionalism to provide necessary support for his family. He started his own work in 2004. He owns a car mechanic shop where he also sells wheels in large quantities.
