Alejandra sigue con la actividad de la venta de ropa en su tienda en la populosa zona de la Buenos Aires cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que compro ropa de temporada para surtir su tienda y en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para seguir comprando ropa de temporada ya que esta época es de mucho calor y comprara poleras y camisas por mayor para seguir surtiendo su tienda y brindar variedad de ropa a su clientes y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Alejandra continues to sell items of clothing in her shop on Avenida Buenos Aires. Her last loan worked very well for her because she was able to buy seasonal clothing to stock her shop and this time she is asking for a loan to continue buying seasonal clothing. At this time of year it is very hot and she will buy wholsesale shirts and t-shirts to keep her shop well-stocked and to offer a variety of clothing to her customers. This way she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing such as shirts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She lives in her house with access to neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has been selling fish at the market at both retail and wholesale for one year, working seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include paying rent for the market stall. She does not have any other job.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to be able to purchase more fish for sale and to pay school fees. 

Her challenges include transportation, thieves, seasonality and spoilage. Her dream is to grow her business so that she accumulates a lot of money to enable her to pay school dues for her children. 

She joined MCDT because the organization is interested in improving the lives of poor people. 
						3

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish for resale.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
By the age of 16, Adrian held a management position at a restaurant and steadily worked his way to begin managing four different franchisees consisting of approximately 30 restaurants. Currently 29 years old, Adrian grew tired of the restaurant industry and decided he needed a career change.

In May 2012, Adrian entered the carpet cleaning industry. He says his family has always been in this industry. His grandpa and two of his uncles had different businesses in the field, so since he was a child, he has always been around it, learning everything he needs to do a good job. 

At Deep Clean Carpet Cleaners, located in his hometown of El Paso, Adrian says, “We do the best service at the best price.” 

That service consists of not just carpet cleaning, but car interior and upholstery cleaning as well. He says his customer service, performance and chemicals and machine used set him apart from competitors. Adrian uses a truck mount, which is a carpet cleaning machine that uses hypoallergenic, biodegradable enzymes instead of shampoos to clean and also extracts water. 

After visiting the El Paso Small Business Development Center for business support, Adrian was introduced to Accion Texas Inc., then decided to apply for a loan with Accion. Upon approval, Adrian purchased a Prochem truck mount, which he says will help the vitality of his business as it will do a better job. Because of the loan, Adrian said, “I’m ready to compete with major companies at a local price.”

By next year, Adrian expects to have a second cleaning unit and create jobs for at least two employees, but for the time being, he works alone.

loans.use: To purchase a better cleaning machine to compete with major companies.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar, who is originally from Mexico City, is targeting the Hispanic community via Community Auto Insurance, an independent company that works with unlicensed and international-licensed drivers with not-so-perfect credit and/or driving records. Community Auto Insurance also provides notary public services, Spanish translations and income tax preparation. “I’m here to service my community and help them in any way I can,” he says. 

Though Cesar currently works alone at his office in Garland, Texas, he plans to hire a staff to meet higher demand during the tax and insurance season. He says once people receive their income tax refunds, many tend to purchase cars, which leads to an increase in the purchase of auto insurance policies. 

Before he entered the insurance industry five years ago, Cesar had a lot of friends who were already insurance agents, and from their stories, he found there is a large profit margin as an independent insurance broker, or a third-party insurance agent, who works with multiple insurance companies to offer the best policy and price for his customers.  

“I always knew there was money to be made,” he says. “I just had to wait for the right time.” 

Before going on his own, Cesar was laid off from a full-time job when his employer decided to downsize the company and invest in a management system. He says he was “almost forced” into becoming an entrepreneur. Cesar says losing his job coincided with his discovery of Accion Texas Inc. during a Google search. This ultimately led to making a decision to pursue his dream of self-employment as an insurance broker.  

He applied for a loan and was approved. “The dream of opening my own industry has been one for three years,” he says. “I submitted my goals to banks for the last three years. No one but Accion would help.”

The loan provided immediate funds to start the business. Without a loan, Cesar says, “I’m not going to say I couldn’t start it, but it would have been slow.”

The Accion loan went to start-up costs, Cesar says. Those included renovating a store front, advertising, office furniture, insurance, purchasing a printer and computer equipped with software for tax, policy management and competitive insurance rating, notary public applications, and store signs.  He has five clients and is positioned for substantial growth in the near future.

To learn more about Cesar’s business, visit his website at: www.communityautoinsurance.org.

loans.use: To renovate his office, advertise the business and purchase supplies.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, taken inside his store.

Ghadeer is a 27-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to one son and one daughter. She is a housewife and lives in the Jabalia refugee camp where there is a lack of job opportunities.

For the past three years, Ghadeer's husband has had a small workshop for designing and building various forms of mirrors to sell. He also designs mirrors upon customers' requests. His business has a good demand and is the only source of income to the family.

Ghadeer's husband has not enough money to pay for purchasing basic materials like glass and mirrors that are necessary to continue his work, so Ghadeer decided to help her husband to continue improving his job, which will increase the family's income and create for them better living conditions.

Ghadeer is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing necessary materials like glass and mirrors to continue his job. Taking this loan will improve Ghadeer's husband's work and the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy glass and mirrors.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with four children, who all go to school. She also looks after two additional family members who are orphans. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family. 

Gertrude has a tailoring business, sewing all types of clothes, which she has been running for five years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of cloth. She generates additional income from her bridal wares, nursery school and night parking. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She hopes to own a big bridal shop and salon, and also a tailoring school.

loans.use: Top buy more rolls of cloth

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a 22-year-old single man. For the past three years, Basem has been working in repairing used vehicle radios in order to sell them again to customers. The workshop he has is distinguished by its location, where there is a good customer movement. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also it needs more support to cover the costs from time to time.

Basem is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing used vehicle radios in bulk to repair and sell to clients. This type of project has a good demand from customers in the area where he lives, and the price of these used radios is affordable and acceptable to his customers. 

Taking this loan will meet the demand of customers and increase the sales and improve Basem's income, which will ensure to him a brighter future.

Basem is photographed inside his workshop.

loans.use: To buy more used vehicle radios to repair and sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 51 years old, married, and has one child.  She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. Esterlita has a sari sari (variety) store where she sells commodities such as coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks.

Esterlita is requesting a loan for 12,0000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items to sell such as coffee, sugar, noodles, and canned goods. In the future, she hopes  to become a successful entrepreneur to support her family as well as to save for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase commodities such as coffee, sugar, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is a married and has eight children.  She sells gasoline in San Miguel, Bohol. 

Efrena is requesting for a loan, which she will use to buy more gasoline to sell. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and making it a success. Efrena works hard to earn a living so she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a 51-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is thirty two, while the youngest is ten. She is engaged in sea weed farming. She has been in the business for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP to pay for wood, gasoline, and fishing boat repair and maintenance. She works hard to earn a living. Gloria would like to expand her business by investing in other businesses to support her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for wood, gasoline, and fishing boat repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia is a 59-year-old married woman and mother of seven adult children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than 20 years now. She cooks snack food like rice cakes and sells it to people in her community. 

Arcadia is asking for a loan to buy glutinous rice, sugar and other cooking ingredients.

With these ingredients, she will be able to cook more rice cakes to sell, thus augmenting her income and profit.

In the future, Arcadia dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, sugar, and other cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 35-year-old married man and the father of three young children from San Miguel, Bohol. He has been engaged in the vegetable farming business for more than 3 years; this is the source of his daily income.

Gabriel works hard to support the needs of his family, especially for the schooling of his children.

He is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the plants. With this, Gabriel will be able to produce a healthy, good quality of crops.

In the future, Gabriel dreams of expanding his business to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his vegetable farm.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 52-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol; he has four adult children. He is a farmer working in the rice field, and has been growing rice  for 10 years. 

He is requesting a loan of 8,000 to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings in order for him to have a good harvest. 

In the future, Jose hopes to expand his business by investing in other businesses to support his family, as well as to uplift their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
In order to support the growing needs of her family, Virginia sells a variety of fish in the public market of Camalaniugan, which she has been doing for 40 years. Her weekly gross income is just enough to maintain her business and provide for the family's needs. 

Virginia is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy a large volume of fish from nearby municipalities to sell in the public market. She believes that the loan will help her business succeed and improve her lifestyle as she will be able to earn additional profits and save more money.

loans.use: to purchase a large volume of fish.

loans.name: Liduena

texts.en:
Liduena is a 65-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods to the people of her community.

Liduena is asking for a loan to buy more canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap, shampoo, and other items to sell. 

With this loan, Liduena will be able to attract more buyers to her store, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap, shampoo and other items to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith pertence al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS,la socia continua trabajando en una entidad publica ,ya son varios años que trabaja en esto el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para los estudios de su hijo. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the communal bank SIEMRE JUNTOS. She continues to work for a goverment entity where she has been working for many years. She has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her job everyday. Edith is responsible and dedicated which means she can provide for her family. 

Edith is asking for a loan to cover educational costs for her child. 

She is grateful for the loan and she promises to meet her payments on time according to the established payment plan.

loans.use: to pay for her child's educational studies.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a fish vendor from Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. She is a 47-year-old married woman, and the mother of four children ages 20, 18, 11 and 9. 

Leonila has been in the fish-vending business for more than 10 years; this is the source of her income. Leonila gives her best to earn a living.

Leonila needs additional capital for the expansion for her business, but lacks financial resources. She joined CEVI in order to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization to micro entrepreneurs like her. 

She is requesting for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Leonila wants to make her business a success and augment her income to meet the needs of the family, and for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her market.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 22 years old, married, and has one child. He is from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is dries and sells fish.  He earsns 10,000 PHP a month.

Joseph is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase more fresh fish and  several kilos of salt (to preserve its texture).  In the future, Joseph hopes that his business will be successful so that he can support his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and salt.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 41-year-old, hard-working woman who is married to a farmer named Romeo. They are blessed with two children in elementary school. Mary Ann manages general store in their village, and the income she earns is used for her family's basic needs. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP so she can stock more products such as canned goods, soft drinks, hot dogs, snack food, biscuits, bread and noodles at one time. This will save on transportation costs and enable her to be more able to meet her customers' need. She also will be able to save some money for the next level of her children's education. She just hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: to stock more products such as canned goods, soft drinks, hot dogs, snack food, biscuits, bread and noodles.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is  52 years old, married, and has seven children.  She lives in San Miguel, Bohol.  Lorna is a rice farmer, which she has been doing for more than eight years. Her husband is also a farmer.

Lorna is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the rice.  With the loan, they will be able to produce a high yield from their farm. In the future, Lorna dreams of improving their livelihood and making their business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 33-year-old, married woman, and the mother of two children. In 1998 Mona opened a small grocery store, to help her husband in making their living. She's an ideal woman, because she bears the responsibility of raising her children, and at the same time helps her husband through improving and developing her business. She has 17 years of experience in this field. Mona spends most of her time working at her store, in a way to help her husband in doing his own business freely, to increase their family's income.
 
Mona has been an Al Majmoua borrower for eight loan cycles, with an excellent repayment history. Her previous a loans helped a lot to increase her business capital and improve her family's social and financial situations.

Today Mona is applying for another loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy  a new washing machine, so she can stop washing her family's clothes manually using her hands, and to increase her business capital through buying special offers products.  In addition, she will She will also buy a refrigerator and new cooking pots for her house. Mona is very proud of herself, and very happy with what she has accomplished. She hopes to keep on expanding her grocery business as much as she can, to please her customers and family members.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine, refrigerator and cooking pots for her house, and she will use part of the loan to increase her business capital through buying special offers products

loans.name: Al Jawad A Group

texts.en:
Samira is the featured borrower for Al Jawad A's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is the one seated in the middle.

Samira is a 46-year-old married woman, mother of four children (Zeinab (F) 21, Husein (M) 18, Hala (F) 17,  Mohamad (M) 14). She started selling cosmetics and perfumes six months ago to help her husband in covering most of their expenses, and to spend her free time in a useful and productive way since her husband is working abroad to cover his family's expenses. Samira's customers like her good prices and products, in addition to her good customer service. Samira has a very good reputation. She holds the responsibility of raising and taking care of her children alone since her husband isn't available most of the time.

Samira's requested loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua will be invested in buying a new cosmetics and perfume collection, to increase her income and to ensure a better source of living for her children.

Fatima is a 25-year-old single woman seated on the right. She works as a hair dresser, and is willing to start selling cosmetics through the applied-for loan to increase her income. Nisrine is the one seated on the left. She is a 36-year-old divorced woman and mother of an 8-year-old boy (Reda). She sacrifices her whole life to provide him with everything he might need, and to make sure that he is having a happy childhood. Nisrine is managing to be his mother and father at the same time. She provides him with the care and love of a mother, and the guidance and full responsibility of a father. For the past 11 years, she has owned an international and local call center. She is also improving and developing another business that has to do with facial treatments. That's why her applied-for loan will be invested in the beauty business she is running through increasing the masks and creams requested.

The three ladies are Al Majmoua borrowers for two cycles, and they are very pleased with what they have.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics and perfume collections

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is 47 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in San Miguel, Bohol. Together with her husband, Macaria is a rice farmer, which she has been doing for several years.

Macaria is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With this loan, they will be able to produce a healthy and good quality crop.  Macaria wants to expand her business in the future in order to augment her income.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 43 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in Bien Unido, Bohol.  Leonardo is engaged in seaweed farming, which he has been doing for six years.

Leonardo is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase gasoline for the motor boat, wood, and plastic straw. In the future, he would like to invest in other businesses to support his family and finance his children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, wood, and straw.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is 46 years old and married. He lives in Taiz, Yemen, with seven children. He owns house with his family.

He has requested a loan from AMB to buy some furniture to improve the living conditions of his family. In the future, he would like to own a retail store.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for his house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old married man from Taiz, Yemen. He has four children. He requested a loan of 150,000 YER to buy furniture and painting expenses for his home. In the future, he would like to renew the furniture in his home. Ali is looking forward to improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to renew the furniture for his home.

loans.name: Maria Group

texts.en:
This group is called Maria and consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.

Wahba is a 37-year-old married woman and has five children. Her educational background is secondary school. She is a quilter who has been quilting (Mawz) men's fabrics for ten years. She is very experienced and confident in her business.she also is a housewife who intends to buy  home appliance.

so,Wahba is applying for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase a washing machine   for her house. She aspires to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 32 years old and lives in the Tskaltubo District, West Georgia, with her husband, mother-in-law and three children (9, 12 and 14 years old).  Sopio requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up but without success.  Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family's poor living conditions.  The family runs a small-scale agricultural business.  They grow different kinds of vegetables on a family-owned plot of land.  Besides that, Sopio runs a small dairy farm of a calf and two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products, which are sold at the local open market.  In addition, Sopio works as a baker and her husband serves as a daily worker to the local farmers to earn a small monthly income.  Their income is hardly enough to feed the six-member family.  

Sopio requested a loan from Credo to start up a trade business.  Her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program provides credit with soft conditions extended to the country's rural poor.  They do not have access to mainstream credit because they are regarded as "high risk borrowers" due to low income.  

With the loan, Sopio will purchase different kinds of household goods and dishes at wholesale markets and sell them in her village with a price mark-up.  She will take her goods to the local houses.  In time, she will gain loyal customers and increase sales.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly increase the income of the family.  Sopio will work hard and she will be able to improve the living conditions of herself and her family members.

loans.use: to purchase household goods for resale

loans.name: Mirzosharif

texts.ru:
Мирзошариф проживает в районе Восеъ. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Младший сын Мирзошарифа работает в городе Душанбе, старший занимается животноводством вместе с отцом, а дочь студентка.
Мирзошариф занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелко - рогатый и крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 12 лет. Мирзошариф берет кредит для закупа телят, бычков и коровы.
texts.en:
Mirzosharif lives in the Vose region.  He is 54 years old, married, and has three children.  His wife is a housewife.  His younger son works in the city of Dushanbe, and older son helps Mirzosharif with animal husbandry, and he's daughter is a student. 

He works in animal husbandry and raises small and large cattle from his home.  He has been involved in this activity for the past 12 years.  He is taking a loan to buy calves, young bulls and cows.

loans.use: to buy calves, young bulls and cows.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani is a 20-year-old single woman living with her six siblings. Amani is now a university student majoring in Arabic Language. She has applied for this educational loan that will help her in paying her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 29 years old and from a small village of the Gurjaani district, East Georgia. She lives with her husband and two infant children. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard. Maia produces Churchkhela (the traditional sausage-shaped candies - the main ingredients are grape must, nuts and flour) and sells in the village at the local open market. She is very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business.

Maia requested a loan to purchase a stock of nuts for Churchkhela. After the stock of nuts is purchased she will be able to produce more Churchkhela and increase her sales. This will significantly increase the income of her family and thus, she will expand her business. Increased income will help them to improve their living conditions. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of nuts.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru: Отабек житель района Шахритус. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Отабека домохозяйка. Отабек имеет высшее медицинское образование, он врач. На сегодняшний день он хочет заняться животноводством. Отабек создал необходимые условия для того, чтобы начать свою деятельность. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота и корма для них.
texts.en: Otabek lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Otabek completed medical school and is a doctor. He now wants to get involved in animal husbandry, and has done the necessary setup to start this business. He is seeking a loan to buy cattle and cattle feed for them.

loans.use: To buy bulls, cows, and cattle feed

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona lives in Goris town, Syunik region, with her parents and brother. Sona's parents run a little shop, where they trade in clothing. Sona's brother is 11 and attends school.
Sona studies at Goris State University. She is in the second course in her master's degree in the Faculty of Law. She has applied for this loan to pay for tuition fees for the first semester. Sona dreams of becoming a professional lawyer in the future. This loan is important for Sona to finish her studies and make her dream come true after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of this year in her master's course

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit lives in Dvin village of Ararat region. Her family consists of 5 members besides herself: father, mother, brother, sister and grandmother. All members of the family are involved in agriculture. They breed cattle and grow apple, peach, and apricot trees. With the requested loan Anahit will purchase feed for pigs, fertilizer and renovate the greenhouse. The loan is important for Anahit and her family, because it will give them a good opportunity to cover basic costs and to secure the future of the family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, renovation of the greenhouse, and feed for pigs

loans.name: Wendnetondo Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAKINATOU est responsable du  groupe WENDNETONDO.  Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. Un (01) va à l’école et elle a une (01) personne en charge.

Mme vend du garie (farine de manioc), du charbon de bois, des ignames et de l’ananas  depuis 02 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé, à Cotonou et au Ghana. Ses clients sont les femmes car elle revend avec les femmes grossistes.

Elle veut s’acheter  03 sacs de garie et 02 sacs de charbon.

Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices et améliorer son activité. Mme ambitionne devenir grossiste et aider son mari pour les charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sakinatou is the leader of the Wendetondo group. She is married and the mother of two. The eldest is 7 years old and the youngest three years old. One child is in school. She has one other dependent.

Mrs. Sakinatou has been selling “garie” (manioc/cassava flour), charcoal, yams and pineapples for two years. She stocks up in Lomé, in Cotonou and in Ghana. Her customers are women as she  deals with female wholesalers. 

She would like to buy three bags of “garie” and two bags of charcoal. She would like to save her revenues and improve her business. Her goal is to become a wholesaler and to help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy three bags of manioc flour and two bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Haller Wilfredo

texts.es:
El socio Haller pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS,el socio continua con su negocio de compra y venta de celulares y accesorios,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio cuenta con un local donde vende toda su mercaderia  a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

EL socio solicita el credito para la compra de accesorios para celulares.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Haller belongs to the communal bank SIEMPRE JUNTOS. He continues to run his business buying and selling mobile phones and phone accessories. He has been in the business for many years and he has been doing well thanks to his dedication to his business. Haller has a stand where he sells merchandise to his customers. He is responsible and dedicated and as a result he can provide for his family.    

Haller is asking for a loan to buy mobile phone accesories. 

He is grateful for the loan and he promises to pay his installments on time.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children ages 7 and 5. Mirasol has been engaged in the vegetable farming business for five years now. Mirasol is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides.  Mirasol hopes that through this loan, she will be able to produce a good quality of crops, thus increasing her yield and income.  In addition, Mirasol wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Welina

texts.en:
Welina is 51 years old and married.  She runs a sari-sari store or variety store, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She sells various goods to the people in her neighborhood in San Miguel, Bohol.

Welina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, and other items. With this loan, she will be able to cater to more customers in her store.  In the future, Welina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Hande Group

texts.fr:
Mme HANGNIDE représente le groupe  HANDE. Elle se porte bien ainsi que toute sa famille. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et prêt à porté pour enfant  depuis 04ans. Son ancien crédit s’est bien déroulé. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de  secteur 10. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes de son quartier et des  quartiers  voisins.
Mme veut s’acheter  10 complets pagnes et 30 prêts à porter. 
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle  a pour ambition  d’installer un hangar, acheter un motocycle et  aider son mari avec  les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Hangnide is the representative of the HANDE group.  She is doing well, and so is her family.  She is married and the mother of two children, ages 7 and 4.  One of her children goes to school, and she has one person in her care.

Hangnide has been selling pagnes (traditional African fabrics) and ready-to-wear clothing for children for the past four years.  Her previous loan was successfully completed.  She stocks up at the District 10 market.  Her clients are men and women from her neighborhood as well as from surrounding neighborhoods.

She would like to buy 10 sets of pagnes and 30 sets of ready-to-wear clothing.

Hangnide wants to save her profits.  Her ambition is to have a covered stall, buy a motorcycle and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 sets of pagnes and 30 sets of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad con, vive junto a su esposo en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque,la calidad de vida en la comunidad donde reside es de subsistencia, la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura y a trabajar como dependientes en labores agrícolas (jornal). 
Su comunidad es una zona rural a 15  minutos de Lambayeque. Está conformada por 25 familias aproximadamente.

La actividad comercial que realiza es la crianza y comercialización de animales: posee ganado vacuno entre otros animales menores como pavos, patos y pollos. Adicionalmente tiene un terreno agrícola en donde cultiva maíz junto a su esposo. También se dedica a la comercialización de leche. A la fecha cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en dicha actividad.

Martina se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los que tiene pensado invertir en la compra de animales y alimentos de los mismos para ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias. Ella agradece de antemano la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Martina, 45, and her husband live in one of the rural communities of the district of Lambayeque.  The quality of life of the community is one of survival.  Most of the workers are independent and involved in commerce and livestock farming.  They also work as wage earners on other farms.  This community is about 15 minutes from Lambayeque and is comprised of around 25 families.

The business activity she is involved in is raising and selling livestock, such as cattle and other small animals, including turkeys, ducks and chickens.   She also has farmland where she and her husband grow crops, and she also sells milk.  For 20 years she has worked in this trade.

Martina is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa which she plans to use to buy animals and feed to expand her business and increase her income.  She is grateful in advance for the support she receives.

loans.use: To buy animals and feed to expand her business.

loans.name: Yenny Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de papeleria ,la socia vende lo que son lapiceros,papeles,cuadernos entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia tiene su local en Paucartambo provincia de Pilcopata,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como papeles,cuadernos y para algunos gastos personales.

La socia sale en la foto con uno de sus hijos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yenny belongs to the community bank, SIEMPRE JUNTOS, and continues in her stationery business.  She sells pencils, paper, notebooks and other materials.  Business is going well after several years of activity, mainly due to Yenny's dedication.  She has a shop in the town of Paucartambo in the province of Pilcopata.  She is a responsible, hard-working woman who earns a living this way to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as paper and notebooks, and to pay for some personal expenses.

The member is shown with her son in the photo.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as paper and notebooks, and to pay for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Miraveny

texts.en:
Miraveny is a 30-year-old  married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has an 11-year-old daughter. Miraveny owns a sari-sari (variety or general) store in her community. She sells commodities like rice, canned goods, sugar, soaps, and gasoline (for customers who own fishing boats). She usually earns eight thousand pesos a month through sales of her sari sari store.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more commodities to sell like rice, sugar, canned goods, and gasoline. Miraveny would like to invest in her business to support the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy commodities like rice, sugar, canned goods, sugar, soaps, and gasoline.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam’s store has been a big help for her family, as every week she can earn an income of at least 2,000 PHP.  Meriam budgets that income to support her children's education and for their daily needs. 

To further sustain her business, Meriam is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more stock such as soft drinks, spices, beverages, noodles, and biscuits to sell in her store. The loan amount will make her store profitable and hopefully enable her to convert it into a bigger store. In this way, she can provide for the immediate needs of the people in the community and make it more convenient for them, because they will not have to go to the market just to acquire their basic requirements.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as soft drinks, spices, beverages, noodles, and biscuits

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en: Maylinda is 32 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Bien Unido,Bohol. Her oldest child is 10 while the youngest is 6. She engages in food vending by selling tempura, a Japanese dish of seafood or vegetables dipped in batter and deep-fried. She usually earns 8,000 PHP a month through her business. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more tempura ingredients, cooking oil and sauces. In the future, Maylinda would like to expand her business to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy tempura ingredients, cooking oil and sauces.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is  64 years old, married and is from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming for more than 40 years. This is the source of her income.
Eugenia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to produce a good quality crop, thus increasing her yield and income. In the future, Eugenia hopes to make her rice farming business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Yomo Spers Group

texts.en:
The Yomo Spers Group is made up of six women who live in the Teshie community. They chose trading because they could not pursue higher education, and they have not regretted having chosen the trading profession. They sell sandals, vegetables, “Wakye” (a dish composed primarily of cooked rice and beans), underwear, cutlery and palm fruit. 

Mary is 59 years old, married to a 72-year-old pensioner, and they have four children. The children are all grown and are taking care of themselves. Mary sells ladies' footwear. She works to take care of her husband, who is a sick person and has retired from active work. This is her fourth loan cycle, and she needs the amount of 1,100 GHS, to be able to buy more sandals for resale.

Together, the Yomo Spers Group women need a total amount of 2,850 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more footwear for resale to customers.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 34-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is twelve, and the youngest is eleven months old. She has had a sari sari (variety/general) store business for twelve years.  She sells items like rice, noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks to the people in her community. She usually earns about six thousand pesos a  month with her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, noodles, and sugar. In the future, Thelma hopes to expand her business into a big grocery store and to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, canned goods,shampoo, noodles, and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en: Roseminda is 22 years old, married and has two children, ages 1 and 3. She is from Bien Unido,Bohol. She is engaged in the fish-vending business and  has been selling fish for five years. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase a new boat and fishing materials like a fish net. Her husband is a fisherman. Roseminda would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing materials.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has run a sari-sari or variety store business in San Miguel, Bohol for more than five years. She sells goods like biscuits, bread, noodles, canned goods, soap, shampoo, rice and soda.
Evelyn is requesting for a loan to buy additional stock to sell such as soda, canned goods, soap and snack foods.
Through this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income.
In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her store and make it more sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her three children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as soda, canned goods, soap and snack foods.

loans.name: Robesana

texts.en: Robesana is 41 years old, married and has four children. She hails from Bien Unido,Bohol. The oldest child is 20 while the youngest is 4. She has a sari-sari (variety store) business selling items like biscuits, canned goods, sugar, toiletries and sugar. She  usually earns about 6,000 PHP per month through her business. Her husband is a fisherman. She is requesting a loan of 30,000  PHP to buy more items to sell such as rice, gasoline and fishing nets. In the future,  Robesana hopes to expand her business so she would be able to establish a big grocery store. She also hopes to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, gasoline and fishing nets.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 47-year-old, married woman, and the mother of five children, from San Miguel, Bohol. She is currently engaged in a food vending business, selling cooked food to the people in the community.

Felicitas needs additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients, like flour, sugarcane and butter. With this new investment, she will be able to cook more snack food to sell.

In the future, Felicitas wants to expand her business, and to explore another business venture, to augment her income. She will use the income to continually support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, like flour, sugarcane and butter.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans and coffee. They have cows, goats, chickens and pigs. They also run a small shop.

Simon looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Simon will pay school fees for his children. He will also save to buy an additional cow for his farm. His biggest dreams include educating his children, diversifying his livestock, and modernizing his home.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 25 years old. He earns his income primarily through farming. He grows many different crops, including maize, beans, coffee, cassava, groundnuts, bananas, sweet potatoes, avocados and mangoes. He has cows, goats, chickens and pigs. Denis also earns money by performing daily labor tasks for other people in his community.

Denis looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Denis will invest in his farm. He dreams of becoming an agricultural expert.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Safinah

texts.en:
Safinah is 25 years old. She is married and has a four-year-old son. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow coffee, beans and maize. 

Safinah looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Safinah will buy household items such as salt and kerosene (she is happy that she will not have to purchase as much kerosene as she used to, since her CKW business-in-a-box includes a solar charger that she can also use to light her home). She will also save for the chickens that she is planning to buy. 

Her biggest dreams in life are to own a successful poultry business, and to own a fashion boutique where the women in her village can shop.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
She is married and has five children, and she lives in a three-room house in Bamenda, a part of Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The major challenge she has faced was being sick in the hospital for months, with no money to pay hospital bills or purchase drugs in the pharmacy. During that time she also lost her mother and father, so nobody was there to care for her in the hospital. 

This lady joined GHAPE in the year 2012 and has managed, and successfully repaid, one loan. With the new loan requested, she will rent a piece land for farming, buy farming seedlings like maize, beans, yams, and cassava, plus fertilizer. She will buy good improved seedlings for her farming so as to have good yields. Also she intends to keep chicks, when they are six weeks she resells them. With this farming business activity, the community will have a regular supply of farm products like maize, beans and yams, at moderate prices.

She holds a positive view on this business to succeed, because she sells good food, and the entire locality knows her for that, because she sells at a very moderate price, and because her business environment is also neat thus encouraging people to buy from her. 

With the profit from the loan, she will work with her husband to educate the children, to cater for family needs, and to build a more comfortable house. She prefers a loan from GHAPE  because  of its low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals, and because members are educated on loan and business management before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to rent a piece of land and buy chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple products (20 liters of vegetable oil, boxes of soap, sugar etc)

loans.name: Cranaa Group

texts.en:
Bernice is a 40-year-old woman married to Emmanuel, who works in a metal workshop. Bernice sells jeans of all kinds. She is a member of a group called "Cranaa" and they are into the trading of the following items: jeans top and down, fish, pepper, maize, and plastic products. They are five in number. They need a total sum of 1,950 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

This is their third loan with ID-Ghana. Bernice said, "We formed our group because we all need working capital to invest in our businesses. And after working with ID-Ghana, we trust Kiva’s support so that our businesses would flourish. We have gone round assessing several financial institutions, but the one which convinced us is ID-Ghana because their conditions are flexible as compared to others. This informed our decision to work with this organization." 

Bernice’s previous loan amount was 350 Ghana cedis, which is invested into the business. She works every day from Monday to Saturday to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and has been making 100 Ghana cedis per month as profit. She has been doing this job for seven years and hawks from door to door. 

She now needs an amount of 500 Ghana cedis to buy more jeans to sell.

loans.use: to buy jeans and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 49 years old and married with nine children, ranging in age from 7 to 27 years old.  Her husband works as a mechanic and she sells food items.  With this loan, she wants to buy beans and sorghum for sale.  The profits from this will be used to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en: Damascene is 27 years old and single.  He sells animals and has been in the business for four years.  He wants the loan in order to buy cattle and goats for resale.  The profits from this business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and goats for sale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is a mother of eight children. She is a businesswoman and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she will buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 29 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 8.  She sells sorghum and beans.  With this loan, she wants to add more tones of sorghum and beans.  With the profits, she will buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es: Nelson Antonio de  31 anos de edad, soltero padre de dos hijos de 3,5 anos de edad. El originario de Malpaisillo, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del  país. Malpaisillo se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial agrícola muy productiva. La actividad en la que se desempeña Nelson es la venta de artesanías, desde hace seis anos. La cual consiste en viaja al país vecino de Costa Rica y ofrece la artesanía elaborada en nuestro país como ollas de barro, alcancillas, pulseras, jugos de cocina de barro, jarrones, floreros. Los problemas y desafíos en dicha actividad son los impuestos en la frontera los cuales cobran muy alto. El negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que por tradición ha sido un negocio familiar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de artesanía variada. Nelson Antonio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Nelson Antonio, 31, is a single father of two children, ages 3 and 5.  He is from Malpaisillo which is in the northern part of the country and known as a very productive agricultural and commercial area.  Nelson sells crafts for a living and has been in business for six years.  He travels to Costa Rica where he sells Nicaraguan crafts such as clay pots, piggy banks, bracelets, clay cookware jars and vases.  The challenges he faces are the high duty tariffs charged at the border.  

He learned the trade from his parents who ran the business before him.  He is in need of a loan to buy and sell the different craft articles.  Nelson Antonio is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping low income earners in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy crafts such as clay pots, piggy banks, bracelets, clay cookware, jars and vases.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is 46-years-old and has two young children ages 16 and 7.  Her husband is also a farmer. Vilma grows rice and other crops in their field.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm.  In the future, Vilma dreams of improving her farming business so that it will produce a good yielding of crops thus increasing her profits.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Nareth's Group

texts.en:
Nareth is 18 years old and married. She and her family live in a rural village of Kandal Stoeng district, located in Kandal province in Cambodia. She is blessed with a lovely dependent daughter. To make a living, Nareth has been working as a rice farmer for three years, earning around 28,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 8,000 KHR, after offsetting her daily cost of living.

Nareth, a first-time borrower, is leading a group member, who also is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), to apply for a loan in the amount of 160,000 KHR each. 

In order to create a healthy environment for her beloved daughter as well as her whole family, Nareth is planning to use her loan portion to construct an appropriate latrine for her family. Via the help of this requested loan portion, Nareth hopes that she and her family can completely avoid unsanitary practices and successfully promote sanitation and hygiene practices in Cambodia.

loans.use: To construct an appropriate latrine

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa is a married woman and has four children. The oldest child is eighteen while the youngest is ten. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for fifteen years. She earns two thousand pesos a month by doing this farming. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings. In the future, Rufa hopes that her business will be successful and to be able to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She is a vegetable vender and has been selling vegetables for twenty five years. She is a very hardworking and ambitious lady. She has built a house for her family and thanks Faulu Kenya for the financial support they have given her. She also practices farming to earn a living.  She hopes to own a grocery store and have a stable business. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 43 years old. He is married and has five children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow beans, coffee, cassava and other vegetables. They have cows, chickens and pigs. Julius also owns a small shop where he sells commodities such as soap and sugar. 

Julius looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Julius would like to invest in a tree nursery. His biggest dream is to be able to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 26 years old. He earns his income through farming. He grows beans and coffee. He also has cows and chickens.

Benard looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional income that Benard earns as a CKW, he will purchase supplies to grow his farming business. He dreams of being a successful farmer and businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Brendah

texts.en:
Brendah is 28 years old. She is married and has four children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow maize, beans and coffee. They also keep cows, chickens and pigs. 

Brendah looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Brendah will buy more pigs for her farm. She dreams of helping the poorest in her community to lift themselves out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 29 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through farming. They grow bananas, beans, coffee and cassava. They also keep pigs. 

William looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, William will buy agricultural supplies. His main goal in life is to be a moral farmer in his parish.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is 35 years old. He is married and has six children. He and his wife earn their income through farming. They grow bananas, sweet potatoes, onions, cabbage, groundnuts, beans, cassava and coffee. They also have cows, goats, pigs and chickens. 

Deus looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Deus will invest in his farming business. He would like to become a true agricultural expert with a successful farming enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 43 years old. He earns his income through farming. He grows many crops, including passion fruit, potatoes, sunflowers, sweet potatoes, cabbage, onions, eggplant, avocado, mango, oranges, maize, beans, coffee, cassava and pumpkins. He also has cows and pigs.  

Charles looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional income that Charles earns as a CKW, he will buy supplies to improve his pig stable. He dreams of being a model farmer for his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She and her husband earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize and also have pigs on their farm.

Jane looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Jane would like to invest in solar power for her home. She dreams of being able to purchase more land in order to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en:
Cyprian is 29 years old. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans and cassava. He also keeps goats, chickens and pigs.  

Cyprian looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional income that Cyprian earns as a CKW, he will buy materials to improve his farm. He dreams of becoming an agricultural expert.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 28 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She earns her income through farming. She grows pineapples, maize, beans and cassava. She keeps cows and chickens. She also runs a small transport business.

Immaculate looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Immaculate will invest in her businesses. She dreams of building her own house someday.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old. He earns his income through farming. He grows maize, beans, coffee and cassava. He also has goats.  

Joseph looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Joseph will buy supplies to grow his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 26 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through farming. They grow and sell coffee beans. They also keep pigs.

Julius looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Julius will invest in his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, vive con junto a su esposo y a su hijo en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque. En toda la zona los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Carmen cuenta con dos negocios en su domicilio: El primero es la venta de chicha de jora (bebida típica hecha a base de maíz)y cervezas y adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta animales menores, cuenta con experiencia de más de seis años en ambas actividades. Ambas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero en los campos de cultivo de la zona

Carmen desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda responder a la demanda que suele incrementarse en fiestas navideñas. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo. Adicionalmente desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio, como compra de materiales para ampliarlo.

Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Kiva y Edpyme Alternativa y le ha ido bastante bien, por ello se encuentra muy agradecida, y gracias a la grata experiencia que pasó, ha decidido recurrir nuevamente a la buena voluntad de los prestamistas de Kiva, a los cuales agradece de antemano su ayuda.
texts.en:
Carmen, 32, lives with her husband and son in their own house which has electricity and running water.  It is located in the rural area of the department of Lambayeque, which is an agricultural, live-stock farming, tourism area.

Carmen runs two business from her home: the first is selling a corn-based drink known as "chicha de jora" and beer.  She also raises and sells small animals and has been in both business for over six years.  Her work allows her to help her husband cover household expenses.  Her husband is a wage earner and works on farms in the area.

Carmen wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced animal feed so she can respond to the increase in demand over the Christmas holidays.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PEN to meet her goal.  She also wants to carry out some home improvements and will buy materials to do so.

She has worked with Kiva and Edpyme Alternativa before and is very grateful.  Thanks to her positive experience she has decided to resort to the good will of Kiva lenders once again, and thanks them in advance for their support.

loans.use: To buy animals and feed to expand her business, and to buy materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as cornstarch, vaseline, glue and other supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:

James also earns another income by providing day care services. He is very hardworking and willing to learn and Faulu Kenya has helped him become financially stable.

He plans on expanding his business and become successful in life. He requires a loan of 53,156 KES to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Judith

Having learnt how to manage her business through the help and support of Faulu Kenya, Judith dreams of having a big business. She is now requesting a loan of 21,363.75 KES to increase her vegetable stock.

loans.use: to increase her vegetable stock.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:

Josefa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, they will be able to produce good quality crops, thus increasing their yield and income from the farm.  In the future, Josefa dreams of improving their livelihood and to experience fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Mutiifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabuo est une jeune femme, trésorière du groupement d’affaire Tumusifu, entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vont a l’école. Cette cliente vit sans mari. Elle est sociétaire d’un petit restaurant de faubourg. Elle commença cette entreprise avec le crédit de Hekima, cela, vers les années 2009. Elle vient de réaliser 16 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de haricots, 30 kg de pommes de terre, 25 litres d’huile, du sel, 1 sac de braises, etc.   Dans le futur, la cliente rêve acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Dit-elle dans l’ancien temps, elle était sous logée par un membre de sa famille. Alors, actuellement, elle se paye maintenant le loyer. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien sans cesse aux petits entrepreneurs femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
Kabuo is a young single woman aged 36, and the treasurer of the business group Tumusifu. She is an entrepreneur and the mother of four children who attend school. She is the owner of a small restaurant in a local suburb. She began her business in 2009 with the help of a loan from Hekima.

Kabuo has just completed 16 cycles in the micro loan program. Her current loan will be used to buy two sacks of beans, 30 kg of potatoes, 25 liters of oil, salt, and one sack of coal, among other supplies. It is Kabuo's dream to someday be able to purchase a plot of land for her children. Kabuo has said that she was previously able to live with a family member, but that she now pays for rent expenses. She is thankful to Hekima for the support it provides to women entrepreneurs who would otherwise not be able to start their own small businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant, including two sacks of beans, 30 kg of potatoes, 25 liters of oil, salt, and one sack of coal.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Soutoura ont  en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe décident  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire, 
Madame,   BABA LASSINA  (2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite) excelle dans la vente de datou. Elle est très sollicitée au marché de Mopti où elle effectue ses ventes surtout les jours de foire et où beaucoup de ses clients viennent des  environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  500 kg de dah qu’elle transforme en "datou"(une sorte de cube maggi locale).  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 7.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider
son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women who compose the Soutoura group are mostly married in extended traditional families.  On average, they are 35 years old and have five children each.  They all live in a village called Niazekan, located in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, commerce and kinship, and they buy and sell condiments.

In order to meet the needs of an increasingly numerous and demanding group of customers, the members of the group have decided to join the micro-loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first solidarity loan.

Baba Lassina, second from the left in the photo, is a very experienced "datou" seller. [Datou is a fermented condiment made from dah, a species of hibiscus].  Her goods are in high demand at the Mopti market.  On market days especially, she sells to many customers who come from surrounding areas.

She is planning to use her loan to buy 500 kg of dah which she will processes into "datou". 

She sells for cash to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

Baba Lassina is expecting average monthly profits from this loan to reach 7,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity and also used to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy some "dah" (or Roselle, a species of Hibiscus)

loans.name: Mario Genaro

texts.es: Mario Genaro de 52 anos de edad, casado con tres hijos de 22, 18,7 anos, él es originario de León, lugar que esta ubicado en el occidente del país. Mario Genaro tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de ganado, actividad que el inicio hace 12 anos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado de forma ambulante. Él viaja unas 3 veces por semana a las comarcas aledañas ofreciendo el ganado a clientes fijos y eventuales. Mario Genaro ha demostrado ser un hombre responsable, trabajador. En los créditos anteriores el demostró su puntualidad en los pagos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en  capital de trabajo  y comprar  un ganado que le están ofreciendo  a buen precio. Mario Genaro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mario Genaro is 52 years old, and is married with three children, aged 22, 18, and 7. He is a native of León, located in the western part of the country. 

He makes a living by raising and selling livestock, which he started doing 12 years ago. He makes his sales as a street vendor. He travels about 3 times a week to surrounding regions, offering livestock to new and regular customers. 

Mario Genaro has proven to be a responsible, hard-working man. With his previous loans he demonstrated punctuality in his payments. 

He needs funding to invest in working capital and buy a herd of cattle that is being offered at a good price. 

Mario Genaro appreciates the help that Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, to make a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy a herd of cattle at a good price

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 62 years old, married, and has six children. He is a horticultural farmer and has been farming for the past 14 years. He also earns an income from livestock farming and is very ambitious and hardworking. He hopes to grow a tremendous amount of flowers and expand his business. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for his flowers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and chemicals for the flowers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits to earn a living. Faulu Kenya has helped her start saving and also expand her business. She hopes to expand her business more and be a major vegetable supplier. She requests a loan of 50,000 KES to buy vegetables and fruits for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Yereta N°2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les six femmes du groupe Yereta N°2 ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres, de céréales, de savons et biens d'autres articles divers. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  Chata Solo  (1 ère femme debout sur la photo en foulard rouge) excelle dans la vente de savons. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de savons (kabakourouni) et 2 sacs de savons (Barika Tigui) et  s’approvisionne à Koutiala.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
