texts.en: Luvuno, 56, is a married mother who lives in the town of Samburu.  She is a mother of four grown children between the ages of 21 and 33 years.  She is a visionary woman who has been selling firewood for several years.  Thanks to her efforts; she has been able to educate her children.  However, three years ago, Luvuno decided to open a small grocery store where she sells common household items like basic grains, flour, oils, cleaning items, etc. She also sells fresh water from her home.  Her desire is to see her store expand into a bigger retail shop.  Luvuno says that her inventory has gone down and she wants to make some investments.  She is therefore asking for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy basic grains, flour, soaps and detergents, snacks etc. This way, she is sure to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, flour, soaps and detergents, snacks etc.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children who all attend school.  She also takes care of one additional family member.  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

She sells secondhand clothes at the market to retail customers.  She has been in this business for the last eight years.  She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO in order to buy more secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler of used clothes and to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a woman of high integrity.  She is married and a beautiful lady who is not yet blessed with a child.  She feels responsible and helps her spouse with the household expenses. 

Elizabeth owns a cosmetic shop that is three months old.  She is very proud of it.  She received the starting capital from her husband who is employed.  Her dream is to open a boutique.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics and other beauty products to ensure that her customers have a variety of products to choose from.  As a result, she is sure she will increase her profits and be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 34, is married and a mother of three. She lives with her family in the suburban area of Samburu where she does her tailoring work. She has been doing this since 2005, and she has never regretted it. 

Grace is determined to meet her goals, one of them being to open a dressmaking college. She is also an active member of Yehu and has shown good morals and can therefore be trusted, as shown by her previous Yehu loan. 

She makes a variety of garments. This loan will help her buy fabrics, buttons, laces, threads, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, laces, threads, etc., for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 52 years old and married to Domingo. She is a hardworking woman. She has two grown children. Josie is from the village of Bagong Silang in the province of Isabela. 

Josie engages in fattening pigs. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that someday she can meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: In every day of the week, Roseline is seen in her small stationery store with her daily activities in progress. She lives with her life companion in the town of Samburu but they are not yet blessed with children. Her husband is a driver. She has been in this business for the last two years and she counts good results from it. Her customers have requested some stationery which is out of stock. She does not want to disappoint them which is which is why she is asking for a loan to buy text books, exercise books, and other stationery. Roseline aims at buying a photocopier and another printer.

loans.use: to buy text books, exercise books, and other stationery.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children who both attend school.  She also takes care of one additional family member, her daughter-in-law.  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

She sells secondhand shoes at the market to retail customers.  She earns additional income from farming.  She has been in business for the last three years.  She works seven days a week.  She has requested for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO in order to buy more secondhand shoes.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a wholesale shop and to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 52 years, married with six children, and lives in the province of Isabela. The people there raise animals and do farming. Her husband works as a farmer, and the house they live in is their property. Avelina works as a furniture maker. That's why she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 for her furniture. Aside from the furniture business, she raises chickens and pigs, which she sells in the community. Her goal is to grow her furniture business.

loans.use: to buy a planer, wood and nails for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 42-year-old business lady, she is widowed with three children. She has been running an electronic accessories shop for the past ten years as her primary business, and she also manages a small food restaurant as her secondary business. With the monthly income of KES. 25,000, she supports her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Esther will use the loan to buy more cabling wires and bulbs for sale in the electronic shop as well as to buy sugar and cooking oil for use in the restaurant.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a cereal store and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cabling wires and bulbs for the electronic shop as well as buy sugar and cooking oil for the restaurant.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 35-year-old businessman. He is still doing a motorcycle transport business, which is doing well. He bought a motorcycle with the previous loan. His wife has also been doing dairy farming and crop farming and their family income has increased. 

Peter made a profit from the previous loan. He bought a pig and paid school fees for his two children. He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and pesticides, and also dairy feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his pig farming project. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a big piece of land, buy three dairy cows and 50 pigs, and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs like fertilizer and pesticides, and also dairy feed.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children, one and five years old.He owns a retail shop, selling food and dry goods. He has been in business for five years.Philip earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.  

He is requesting a second loan, of KES.65,000, from KADET LTD, after repaying his previous loan successfully. He intends to use the loan proceeds to purchase sugar, tea leaves, matches, salt, cooking fat,and bar soap for his shop. 


The profits will be ploughed back into the business. He hopes to live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves, matches, salt, cooking fat, and bar soap for his retail shop.

loans.name: Annrita

texts.en:
Annrita is 30 years old.  She is a farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya where she lives with her husband and two children, one of whom attends school.  She has been practicing mixed farming for three years and produces milk and vegetables, which she sells at the local market in her area.   Poor infrastructures and drought are the main challenges she faces in farming.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a water tank for irrigation.  This would help her to increase both her production and her income, enabling her to improve her family’s standard of living and to pay for the children's school fees.  She aspires to open a cereal store in the next five years.

Annrita says that Juhudi Kilimo is the best microfinance company for small-scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió en el año 2011, está en su sexto ciclo y trabajan por salir adelante e ir creciendo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia y por medio de su esfuerzo dan todo a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Carmen, ella tiene 5 hijos,  está acompañada  con el Sr. Aurelio y ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas. Gracias a este trabajo ella y Don Aurelio se ayudan y dan a sus hijos lo que necesitan para una vida sin necesidades.
Ella solicita de este crédito, para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, y así dar buena variedad a sus clientes, ya que sabe que por medio de eso podrá atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación was established in 2011. The members are in their sixth loan cycle and are working together so that they can move forward and continue growing. These women are the heads of their households, so they strive to provide everything for their families.

One of the group members is Sra. Carmen. She has five children and is married to Sr. Aurelio. Carmen has been selling clothes for several years. Thanks to the work she and Don Aurelio have done, they have been able to help their children and provide them with what they need to have a full life.

Carmen is requesting this loan so that she can buy all types of clothing in order to offer a wide variety to her customers. She knows that this will also help her to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, gran parte de su vida la compartió con su esposo Fidel, de 44 años también, producto del amor tienen a su hija Cesia de 23 años,y juntos desempeñan actividades con miras a un futuro mejor. Actualmente residen en una vivienda alquilada. Se inicio en la venta de combustible, en un grifo cuya dueña es su hermana quien al encontrar otras oportunidades de negocio optó por alquilárselo, es así como desde hace 1 año expende diversos hidrocarburos a los moto taxistas y vehículos mayores de la zona, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija quien la apoya en ocasiones. Asimismo agrega la venta balones de gas, negocio que le deja con muy buenas ganancias. No obstante el retrazo de los camiones cisterna que son sus proveedores mayoristas la dejan desabastecida algunas veces. Al encontrarse un incremento  en la venta de balones con gas desea realizar la compra de los mismos en mayor cantidad para así obtener mayores ganancias, añadiendo también a ello la compra de combustible. Tiene los deseos de a futuro ser la propietaria de su propio grifo, pues desea adquirir su propia maquina surtidora y la búsqueda de un local apropiado. Este es su crédito número 18, muestra su profundo agradecimiento debido a que gracias a ello puede desempeñarse económicamente con mucha facilidad y  tranquilidad. Le agrada el hecho de ser parte de un banco comunal en donde sus integrantes muestran siempre el optimismo, así como la puntualidad en sus pagos. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de balones de gas y en la compra de más combustible.
texts.en: Julia is 44 years old. She has shared a large portion of her life with her husband Fidel, who's also 44. As a result of their love they have their 23-year-old daughter Cesia, and they work together so that they can achieve a better future. They currently live in a rented house. She first started selling fuel in a gas station owned by her sister. When her sister found other business opportunities, she decided to rent out the station. That's why she has been selling fuel oil to local motorcycle taxi drivers and larger vehicles for the past year. She gets support from her daughter who helps her occasionally. She also sells gas cylinders, a business that earns her very good profits. However, sometimes she's left undersupplied when there's a delay with the tankers from her wholesale suppliers. Since she's facing an increase in the gas cylinder sales, she wishes to buy them in bulk in order to obtain better profits. In addition, she wishes to buy fuel. She hopes to someday own her own gas station, thus she wishes to buy her own machinery and search for an appropriate venue. This is her 18th loan. She expresses her deep gratitude because thanks to the loans she's able to fufill her financial obligations with ease and serenity. She enjoys the fact that she's part of a communal bank whose members are always optimistic as well as punctual with their repayments. With the 2000 nuevos soles she'll purchase gas cylinders and more fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and gas cylinders.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 41 years old and a mother of three children aged 16, 15 and three and half. She owns a nursery school and day care center, a business she has run for the past two years.

With this loan, Florah plans to buy mattresses and other school equipment so that the children can be comfortable. She desires to expand her school to primary level so that she can help many children. 

It is her hope to be able to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and other school equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to transport construction products to the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for the meat she sells.

loans.name: Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTOCABLES”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Josefa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de medicina natural, imprenta, venta de vajillas, elaboración y venta de masitas, atención de café, venta de ropa nueva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias de la Banca Comunal Intocables que en la actualidad tiene un año de vida. La señora Josefa participa por primera véz en este grupo, pues las integrantes la invitaron a participar del grupo en su segunda face. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medicina natural que es un negocio familiar desde hace años y que en la actualidad lo comercializa conjuntamente su concubino.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de medicina natural) que adquirirá del departamento de Santa Cruz por mayor posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que sus compañeras de grupo son muy cumplidas con los pagos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Intocables" [Untouchables] will start its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II Community Centre. It has eight members and is run by a board of directors with Josefa as the board president. The members' businesses are varied and include: a small store, selling natural medicines, a printing business, selling dishes, preparing and selling traditional pastries, serving coffee and selling new clothes. 

The loan will be used to benefit the micro-companies in the group of the Untouchables Communal Bank which has been in existence for a year. This is Josefa's first time in this group, after receiving the invitation from a friend who is a member of the group which is in its second cycle. At present Josefa has a business selling natural medicines. It is a family business that has been running for many years. At present she runs this business with her common-law husband.

This loan is to increase capital (to buy natural medicines) which she will purchase wholesale in the Santa Cruz region. Then she will sell the natural medicines by travelling around the markets in El Alto city. This type of work enables her to earn money to support her family financially as she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes that the group members honour the repayments.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Clisanta

texts.es:
La señora Clisanta  de 63 años de edad, tiene ocho hijos, su casa esta ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante sus  clientes son los amigos, familiares y vecinos que ella visita tres veces por semana, Doña Clisanta es una mujer sola y con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia. 
Doña Clisanta esta solicitando 15,000.00 para la compra de pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, cameras y camisas, ya que para esta época se vende bastante este tipo de prendas de vestir. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y así tener mejores ganancias y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Doña Clisanta su sueño es crecer en su negocio  y que sus hijos que radican en los estados unidos estén bien.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Clisanta is 63 years old and has eight children. Her house is located in the village of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has been making traveling sales of used clothing for the past 20 years. Her customers are her friends, relatives and neighbors whom she visits three times a week. Clisanta is a single woman with a great deal of drive to get her family ahead.
Clisanta is requesting 15000 lempiras (HNL) in order to purchase trousers, blouses, children's clothing and shirts, since these kinds of garments sell very well this time of the year. With the support of this loan she intends to get the funding she needs for her business, and therefore increase her profits and improve her living conditions a bit.
Her dream is to see her business grow and her children who live in the US doing well.
San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2012.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, children's clothing and shirts for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret always dreams of being a prominent lady in the community. She wants to have a prosperous future to ensure that her children do not lack any basic needs. She is currently single but in a very serious relationship that will soon lead to marriage.

For the past five years, Margaret has been operating a salon in the town of Samburu. A very open-minded lady who believes in effort and determination, she has regular customers due to her fast service delivery and stocks of various beauty products. She is requesting this loan to buy braids, hair nutrients, hair relaxers, shampoo, and other beauty chemicals.

loans.use: to buy braids, hair nutrients, hair relaxers, shampoo, and other beauty chemicals.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.es:
El socio sigue trabajando como profesor,el enseña a diferentes alumnos,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio es una persona emprendedora y muy trabajador,el socio sigue escribiendo sus libros de matematicas para colegio secuandaria y universitaria,el sueño del socio es abrir su propia academia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar papeles y tintas para que escriba los libros.

El está contento con el préstamo, y que se compromete a hacer sus pagos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Arthur continues to work as a professor, teaching a variety of students. He works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. He is an enterprising and hardworking person. Arthur continues writing his books to teach high school and college-level mathematics. His goal is to one day open his own school.

Arthur is requesting this loan to buy paper and ink so he can write his books. He is very happy to receive this loan and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink so he can write his books.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икром является одним из успешных  бизнесменов в своем районе. Ему 24 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 1 годика. Более 5 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, морковь, капуста и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000  сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для улучшения условия жилья. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ikrom is one of the most successful businessmen in his region. He is 24 years old. He is married and raising one child, who is one year old. 

Ikrom has been growing agricultural crops, such as potatoes, carrots, cabbage and similar, for more than five years. He sells the harvest at the market. His wife helps him in running the business. 

In order to provide the family with all necessary means, he would like to develop his business, and for this he needs to get a larger harvest. He requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni, in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds. He will use the income received from the business to increase their living conditions. He needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is married and lives with her husband and five children. She is engaged in agriculture and cultivates her land, but her current income is not enough to sustain her family properly. Zenaida would like to develop her agriculture business and get more income. She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase corn and rice seeds, and fertilizer. Her loan will help her earn additional income, pay for her children’s education, and ensure a sustainable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Luz de 51 años de edad,  vive con tres de sus cuatro  hijos  en su casa ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de ropa interior, lociones, cremas, y carne de cerdos de manera ambulante sus  clientes son los amigos, familiares y vecinos que ella a diario  visita, Doña Luz es una mujer luchadoras y con muchas  ganas de sacar adelante a su familia. 
Doña Luz esta solicitando 15,000.00 para la compra de cosméticos, cerdos, blusas, ropa de niños,  ya que para esta época se vende bastante este tipo de prendas de vestir y la carne de cerdo. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y de esta manera tener mejores ganancias y mejorar un poco su condición de vida.
Doña Luz su sueño es crecer en su negocio  y mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Doña Luz is 51 years old and lives with three of her four children in her house, located in the community of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. For ten years, Luz has made a living selling underwear, lotion, and pork meat, door-to-door. Most of her clients are her friends, family members, and neighbors who she visits daily. Doña Luz is a determined woman who strives to help her family get ahead. 

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras in order to buy cosmetics, blouses, pork, and children's clothing. With the financial support of this loan, Doña Luz will invest in her business and, in this way, increase her earnings and improve her quality of life a little bit. Her dream is to one day expand her business and to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2012

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, pigs, blouses, and children's clothing for her business.

loans.name: Joiner

texts.en:
Every person has the desire to obtain a life worth living and to feel responsible in the society. Joiner is not an exception to this. She is a single, beautiful woman who takes care of her two children, who go to school. 

She has a small locale at the market, where she sells fruits, like bananas, mangoes and avocadoes, among others. She already has established a good customer base, and she counts on good results from her business. Thanks to the quality of her fruits, the affordable prices, and above all, the unequaled service she offers her customers, Joiner has been able to add more customers every day. 

She wants to make some investments in her business so as to meet her customers' needs. Joiner wants to use a loan to buy more fresh fruits for sale.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for sale.

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru: Нозимджону 24 года. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и его жена домохозяйка. Нозимджон единственный кормилец в семье. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 4 года назад он начал свой бизнес услугой перевозки своим грузовиком. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он всегда старается сделать индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту и таким образом привлечь много клиентов, но для привлечения больше клиентов состояние его грузовика ему мешает. Он  срочно должен отремонтировать свой грузовик. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони  для ремонта грузовика. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем держать свой стимул среди бизнесменов.
texts.en:
Nozimjon is 24 years old. He is a very hard working and purposeful man. He is married and his wife is a housewife. 

Nozimjon is the only wage-earner in the family. In order to provide his family with all necessary means, he started his business of running a transportation service with his truck. His efficiency helps him to be successful in his business. 

He always tries to give individual treatment to each client and in this way attract many customers, but the state of his truck is hindering him in attracting more customers. He urgently needs to repair his truck. He requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni for the repair. He awaits your kindness. Please help, as this will make it possible for him to keep his advantage among other businessmen.

loans.use: To repair his lorry

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS,el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Cerafina tiene 38 años de edad,04 hijos y es convivente,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes ,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al  empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el cedito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cerafina is a member of the communal bank SIEMPRE JUNTOS (Always Together) located in the Wanchaq province of the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old and has four children that live with her. Cerafina balances her daily home activities with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs. She raises these animals to later sell to clients that request them. She has been in this business for many years now and, thanks to the determination she enters each day with, it has gone very well for her. Cerafina is a responsible and determined person who is trying to help her family get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. Cerafina is very grateful for the loan she has been granted and she promises to make all of her repayments without fail.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Хамида имеет среднее образование. Она хочет начать свой бизнес. Для этого ей необходима финансовая поддержка, так как она раньше не где не работала. Хамида намерена взять в аренду помещение, где откроет продуктовый магазин. Также ей необходимо закупить необходимые продукты. Хамида берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания и для аренды помещения.
texts.en:
Hamida lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 42 years old and married. She has four children. Hamida has secondary education. She would like to start her own business. For this she needs financial support, as she has previously not worked anywhere. 

Hamida intends to rent premises where she can open a grocery store. Further she needs to purchase necessary products. Hamida takes a loan for the purchase of food and for the rent of premises.

loans.use: to purchase food for selling and to rent premises

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman who is blessed with two children. Her husband is a businessman. She has had a salon for the past year and she has obtained the experience that keeps her going. Her customers like her because of her jovial nature and the good services she offers. 

Rachel says that she faces competition in her area of work and she has to find ways in which she can outshine her competitors. One method to do this is to make sure that she has what her customers request. However, she does not have enough capital to invest in a variety of products. For this reason, she is asking for support in the form of a loan to buy cosmetics and other beauty products and chemicals to improve her service delivery and also to offer a variety for her customers to choose.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 43 years old. Felicidad is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 32 years old. Elsie is married and has three school-aged children. Elsie owns and operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

location.town: Cabisera 5, Baribad, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela

loans.name: Ganpurev

texts.en:
Mr. Ganpurev lives with his wife and his four children in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He plants vegetables with his wife and children.

He has been an agrarian for 23 years now. He has improved his skills and variety of vegetables over the years. He is popular within the province for his organic vegetable production. Last spring, he planted potatoes, carrots, cabbages, and tomatoes in 1.2 hectares. His wife sells at a rental counter at the market. 

Ganpurev has built a 15-ton storage pit in his own land. He is planning to build a greenhouse to increase his plantation duration. He is requesting 600,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to purchase necessary materials for building a greenhouse for his organic vegetable production business. He is a calm and clever person.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for building a greenhouse for his organic vegetable production business.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She does not look after any other family members.  She has been selling jackfruit in the retail market for three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.  She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to enable her to stock more jackfruit. Her challenges include thieves and seasonality of supply. Her dream is to be able to collect the fruits herself from the village and sell them at wholesale as well as retail.  She joined MCDT SACCO because of the low-interest rate charged on loans. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy more jackfruit.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 43-year-old, married woman. Marilyn and her husband, Armando, have two grownup children. She lives with her husband and their children.

To earn a living, Marilyn is involved in the farming industry. She has two years of experience in this field. Marilyn’s husband helps her run her farm. Their farming operations are the only source of income for their family, and she explains that they earn approximately 20,000 PHP of profit per crop yield.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to expand and improve her business. With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers, which she expects will help to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Doña Simona tiene 44 años, 5 hijos y su fiel compañero y esposo Francisco de 43 años, juntos conforman un familia casi numerosa pero con el único cariño y afecto que solo pueden dar unos padres trabajadores y con muchos sueños, posee actualmente una vivienda de material noble construida con ayuda de sus familiares. Realiza una de las actividades mas productivas de su región consistente en la producción de granos de café, viene desempeñándose con bastante impulso desde hace 4 años contando desde ya con el apoyo de Francisco y en ocasiones también convocando a sus hijos para actividades menores. Le agrada trabajar con plantaciones de café ya que uno los procesos mas sencillos es la cosecha, no obstante el manteniendo y sembrado requieren un trabajo de paciencia y colectividad logrando solo así finalmente obtener granos de calidad que son bien cotizados por los acopiadores.
Se encuentra en buena temporada, por lo que debe aprovechar en plantar y fertilizar café. Sin embargo, para esperar la cosecha de estos granos debe esperar meses y en ese tiempo desea dedicarse a otra cosa, como vender, por ello desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su localidad. Así se generarí ingresos extras. Lleva 17 préstamos con MFP, como una persona de basta experiencia con el tema crediticio ha sido muy puntual, pues a futuro desea solicitar un crédito mayor. Le agrada mucho el trabajo en su banco comunal debido a que los integrantes son personas muy confiables y respetuosas.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles podrá contratar jornaleros para iniciar la época de plantación de café así como la adquisición de plantas de éste grano.
texts.en:
Simona is 44 years old and has five children with her faithful husband and companion, Francisco, 43. Together they make up a large family, with the care and affection that can only be given by hardworking parents who are full of dreams. She currently has a house made of good materials, built with the help of her relatives. 

She works in one of the most consistent and productive activities in the region, coffee bean production. She has been developing her business for four years with good momentum, counting on the support of Francisco. She also calls on her children occasionally to help with minor activities.

She enjoys working with coffee plantations because one of the most simple processes is the harvest. Nevertheless, maintaining and planting the plantation requires patient, collective labor, as this is the only way to obtain good quality beans which are valued well by middlemen.

She is currently experiencing a good season, so she should take advantage of this period to plant and fertilize the coffee. However, she will be waiting for several months for the harvest of these beans, and during that time she would like to take up something else, such as sales. Therefore, she would like to open a grocery store in her town. This would help her to earn additional income.

She has taken out 17 loans with MFP. As a person with plenty of experience with loans, she has been on time with her payments, since she would like to take out a greater loan in the future. She enjoys working with her communal bank very much, because the members are trustworthy and respectful people.

With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, she will be able to hire day laborers to begin the coffee planting season. She will also be able to buy more coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
The word "honor" best describes Mrs. Wilma. She is married to Arturo, and together they care for their family farm. They have two children and live in a community in the Rizal province of Isabela. Agriculture is the main source of income for the local residents.

Wilma and her husband grow different crops, including rice, corn and other vegetables. In a typical week, they are able to earn at least 1,500 PHP by selling vegetables, which they harvest on their own. She explains that it takes them approximately three to five months to harvest their crops and to then sell the crops for a profit.

To maintain and improve their farming business and to avoid high-interest debt from other lenders, Wilma has asked for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP from Kiva so she can finance their farming needs (e.g., by buying fertilizers and seeds). Wilma is also planning to use some of the loan proceeds to expand their hog-raising business. She expects to manage the hogs while her husband is working on the farm.

loans.use: to improve her farming business by purchasing fertilizers and seeds and to expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Rayisomzita Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADINA est responsable du  groupe RAYISOMZITA.  Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a deux (02) personnes  en charge.

Mme vend du sucre, du sel et du savon depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au marché. Ses clients sont celles qui font les jus, les glettes et la bouillie.

Elle veut s’acheter  04 sacs de sucre,  02 sacs de sel et 02 cartons de savon.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices et veut améliorer son activité en ouvrant une boutique. Mme ambitionne aider son mari pour les charges de la famille et  la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madina is the representative of the RAYISOMZITA group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 12 years old and the youngest is 2.  Two of her children go to school, and she has two people in her care.

Madina has been selling sugar, salt and soap for ten years.  She stocks up from wholesalers at the market.  Her customers are women who prepare juices, flat cakes and hot cereal.

She wants to buy four bags of sugar, two bags of salt and two boxes of soap.

She saves her profits and wants to improve her activity by opening a shop.  Her ambition is to help her husband with the household expenses and the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy four bags of sugar, two bags of salt and two boxes of soap.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El señor  José de 57  años de edad, es casado y  padre de tres  hijos de  edades 28,25, y 30 años,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 7  años ala venta de abarrotería  como ser manteca azúcar, café pollo, embutidos, mantequilla ,queso refresco, jugos, y granos básico como arroz y frijoles. Su negocio es  en su su casa de habitación donde atiende muchos  personas que laboran para una melonera  que a diario llegan comprar a su pulpería.  Su negocio  esta ubicado en  aldea el Espino la Montaña al  sur de Honduras.
Don José esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de abarrotería, como, aceite, café, azúcar, leche en polvo, papel higiénico,  frescos, arroz, frijoles, maíz, lácteos, embutidos y otros productos. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo Don José  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Don José su sueño es mejorar más su negocio y  tener el negocio más fuerte de la comunidad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old and has three children, ages 25, 28 and 30. He has his own house. For seven years, he has made a living selling groceries, such as butter, sugar, coffee, chicken, cold cuts, cheese, soft drinks, juice, and basic grains such as rice and beans. His business is located in his house, where he serves many people who work for a melon farm and come daily to his store. The business is located in the village Espino la Montaña, in the south of Honduras.

José has requested a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to buy groceries, such as oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, toilet paper, soft drinks, rice, beans, corn, dairy products, cold cuts, and other products. With his income and the support of this loan, José hopes to move forward and continue improving his business.

His dream is to improve his business and to have the strongest business in his community.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2012.

loans.use: to buy oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, toilet paper, soft drinks, rice, beans, corn, dairy products, cold cuts, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 54 years old. She is married and has two adult children.

Felicidad owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month for these activities.

Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snack foods, and spices for her store.

location.town: Cabisera 5, Baribad, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela

loans.name: Purevjil

texts.en:
Mr. Purevjil is a 50-year-old man living with his family in their small wooden house in Kherlen, the third largest city in Mongolia. He built his house with wood many years ago. Because the house is old and has thin walls, his family uses a large amount of charcoal to heat their house compared with other households in the area.

Since 2003 he has been working as a taxi-driver; his wife doesn’t have a job. During the winter months, he sometimes goes to the countryside to buy meat from herders, which he sells at a local market for profits. Purevjil explains that he cares for his car as if the car was a member of his family, in large part because it is the only piece of equipment they own which brings income to their family. His family would face many challenges if the car were to break down.

Starting this year, he needs to earn more income because his older son will begin his studies at a university located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. Plus, his younger son studies at a local school.

Therefore, Purevijl is seeking a loan, before the winter begins, to work on his house and to better protect his car from the elements. Specifically, Purevjil is planning to use the loan proceeds to thicken his house's walls and to build a garage for his car. He would build the garage on one side of the house, which ought to cut down on his family's charcoal usage (and prevent or at least delay the car’s breakdown). By taking these steps, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his family's house (by thickening the walls) and to both protect his car and cut down on his family's reliance on charcoal (by building a garage)

loans.name: Rafat

texts.en:
Rafat is a 24-year-old single man.

For the past two years, Rafat has operated a grocery store (pictured), where he sells different types of groceries. He explains that it has been a profitable project, but that he needs more financial support to cover the costs.

As a result, Rafat is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing additional goods often requested by his customers such as rice, sugar, milk and canned foods. With the loan proceeds, Rafat expects to be able to increase sales and in turn increase his income, which will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To expand his business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old, single man. His father is a construction worker, who earns a low salary that is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

For the past two years, Mohammad has operated a small restaurant (pictured), where he offers light meals and sandwiches, as well as soft and hot drinks, to his customers. He explains that the restaurant has been a profitable project, but that he needs more financial support to cover the costs.

As a result, Mohammad is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing necessary supplies for the restaurant (such as plates, cups, and spoons) in addition to soft drinks. He expects that the loan will help to improve the restaurant and to attract more customers to the restaurant, which would in turn increase Mohammad's income and enable him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To expand and improve his restaurant by purchasing additional supplies (e.g., plates, cups, and utensils) and drinks

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 49-year-old married man. He and his wife have four sons and one daughter.

He is an accountant for a local company and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's living expenses. Tareq is building a new house for the family. (Tareq is pictured at the location of his new house.)

To complete construction of the house, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN. Specifically, he would use the loan proceeds to cover the costs of purchasing necessary construction supplies such as bricks and cement. More generally, Tareq expects the loan proceeds to accelerate the house's construction and stability for the family in the near future.

loans.use: To complete construction of his family's house by purchasing supplies such as bricks and cement

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 52-year-old woman living with her spouse in the town of Tiribe. She and her husband have four grown children, all of whom are independent.

She explains that, despite her advanced age, she is a hardworking woman. Four years ago, Mwanakombo started a small retail business by selling various goods. Specifically, she has been selling tobacco from her home; in addition, during the morning hours, she sells dumplings for breakfast. Both businesses are doing well. Thankfully, her children offer their support and help with the businesses.

She is asking for this loan to purchase more tobacco for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: to expand and improve her retail business by purchasing additional tobacco

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en: The desire to have a prosperous future is a common thing to the majority. This is also evident in this woman. Nadzuwa, a mother of one child and a wife to one energetic husband, has been operating a retail shop for the last three years, selling basic household items. She describes herself as honest, kind and God-fearing woman who believes in earning a living through her sweat. She needs to increase her inventory, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy flour, basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, etc. She hopes to own a wholesale business in future.

loans.use: to buy flour, basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 44 años de edad, tiene tres hijos; pero solo una hija de 14 años de edad vive con él y está estudiando el 8ª. Grado, en un centro escolar estatal dentro de la misma comunidad. Él se separado de  su esposa desde hace 6 años, por lo que  se hizo responsable de sus hijos.

Se dedica a trabajar como agricultor, actividad que la realizan de tradición familiar, cultivando maíz, camote y  yuca. Generalmente obtienen buenas cosechas considerando que los campos de siembra son muy fértiles, por estar en las áreas del volcán Chaparrastique y también; posee una yunta de bueyes con los que realiza sus labores de cultivos y ofrece sus servicios a otros agricultores de la zona.

Todos los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en la ciudad, situados a 7 kilómetros  de su vivienda, para transportarlas se asociaron otras personas, debido a que tienen que pagar vehículo particular, en esta comunidad no cuentan con servicio de transporte público.

El préstamo será invertido en el pago de arrendamientos de las tierras que cultiva paga $125.00 por 7,000 metros cuadrados y alquila 28,000 metros cuadrados aproximadamente, las que son de utilidad para pastorear sus bueyes y sus dos vacas; también, para realizar sus cultivos.  Con el capital restante, realizará la cosecha de sus cultivos 10,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, 3,500 metros cuadrados de yuca y 3,062 metros cuadrados de camote.

Con esta inversión asegura la tierra en la que cultiva y pastorea sus semovientes. Su deseo es ampliar más sus áreas de cultivo y dedicarse al cultivo de hortalizas, considera que son más rentables pero requieren de mayor inversión; también, construir su vivienda de bloque y que al menos su hija (última) estudie en algún centro Tecnológico de la zona.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 44, has three children but only his 14-year-old daughter who is in the 8th grade in a local public school is living with him.  He’s been separated from his wife for six years which is why his children are in his care.  He works in agriculture, a family tradition, growing corn, yams and manioc.  He usually gets good harvests since the fields he cultivates are very fertile because they are in the vicinity of the Chaparrastique volcano.  In addition, he owns a team of oxen he uses to do his field chores and also offers their services to other farmers in the area.  He gets all his farm supplies in the city located 7 kilometers from his house.  In order to transport them he partners with others because they must contract a private vehicle since there is no public transportation available in this community.

The loan will be used to pay rental fees for the land he cultivates.  He pays $125 for every 7,000 square meters and he leases a total of 28,000 square meters approximately that are used as grazing land for his oxen and for his two cows and also to grow his crops on.  With the remaining capital, he will plant 10,000 square meters of corn, 3,500 square meters of manioc and 3,062 square meters of yams.

With this investment he will guarantee the land for cultivation and for grazing.  His wish is to expand his planting area and start growing vegetables that he feels are more profitable but that require a larger investment.  He’d also like to build a concrete block house and that at least his youngest daughter studies in some local technological center.

loans.use: para el pago del arrendamiento de las tierras que cultiva paga $125.00 por 7,000 metros cuadrados y alquila 28,000 metros cuadrados aproximadamente.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose became a widower during the early stage of his marriage. Since then, he has been the father and mother of his three daughters: Lean, Shella, and Melvin Joy – 14 years old. 

Jose is very assiduous in his farming business. But due to lack of money, he could not sustain all his farming needs. He really needs to continue his farming business because it is the only means for him to send his children to school and for his eldest child to pursue her college education. 

Jose requests a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. He is really thankful to God that there are people who are willing to lend him without asking for high interest compared to the traders. He is proud that despite being a single parent, he still manages to send his children to school. He is able to do this because he manages the farm and hog raising businesses well. 

Jose is a man with a word of honor. He does not promise anything that he is not sure of. He said that he will sacrifice everything to provide a better life for his children, so he has to work hard and pray for his success.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman. Together with her life partner, they enjoy their marriage with their four children.

Tima explains that she is a woman of many goals. She has been involved in food vending for the last year and, in the process, has established a loyal customer base. Specifically, she sells dumplings. In the future, she aspires to operate her own a café.

She needs to invest in her business but she has insufficient capital of her own to do so. As a result, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000 KES to buy ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oils.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional ingredients (e.g., wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oils).

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is seeking a new loan to invest in her existing business. She is grateful for the support she received from the previous loan, which she says enabled her to increase sales as well as customers. She hopes that this loan will also have a tremendous impact on both her business and her family's living standards. The loan she is now requesting would be used to buy additional fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to expand and improve her tailoring business by purchasing additional fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Owning a boutique sometime is one of Mwanalima’s goals. She is married to a mason and together they have four children. She is a visionary woman who always looks for new opportunities. For two years, Mwanalima has been selling khangas (traditional African cloth) at retail. She at times sells through orders. Some of her customers buy on credit and pay later. Currently, she has received many orders and she does not want to disappoint her regular customers. Mwanalima says that the cash in hand is not enough to cater for the needs of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting for a loan to buy bales of khangas for sell.

loans.use: to buy bales of khangas (traditional African cloth) to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Facing challenges at times leads to some people to give up in life. However, this is not true of this young woman, mother of three children. She is married and lives with her family in the town of Tiribe. All of her children are in school. For the last 12 years, Mariam has been selling cosmetics in a shop. It is a business which has been doing well and she counts good results. She is a very caring, jovial woman who does not believe in failure. She always tries every opportunity that she comes across. Mariam is currently asking for a loan to purchase more cosmetic and beauty products to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic and beauty products.

loans.name: Khishigjargal

texts.en:
Khishigjargal is a 38-year-old woman who trained as a professional plasterer. She lives with her husband and three kids in a "ger" (Mongolian yurt) in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son is a student at university, while the other two attend a local secondary school. Khishigjargal has been operating a shoe-making and -retailing business since 1998, together with her husband. 

Khishigjargal sells their handmade shoes at a large outdoor market in Mongolia.  Over the past years, they have gained a large number of customers from the countryside; therefore, they make shoes to order as well. Her husband and one assistant make the handcrafted shoes, while Khishigjargal runs the market stall. The business profitability depends on the season, yet the business goes well all the time.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to make more shoes for this fall season. She is a hard-working woman, who wants to provide her children with an excellent education. She is also one of our very trusted Kiva clients.

loans.use: to increase her working capital, so she can buy more materials for making handcrafted shoes.

loans.name: Marlen

texts.es:
La señora Marlen de 30 años de edad es  madre soltera y tiene una hija de tres años   de  edad,  tiene local  propio y se dedica desde hace 1  años ala crianza y engorde de pollos, su negocio es en toda la región donde entrega su producto ya empacado listo para consumirlo, sus clientes son todas las pulpería y mercaditos que le hacen pedidos  cada quince días, y todos las personas de la comunidad que llegan a  comprar a su casa de habitación. Su negocio  esta ubicado en  la comunidad del Espino la Montaña al sur de Honduras.
Doña Marlen esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de concentrado, vacunas y vitaminas para su granja. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  Doña Marlen  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Doña Marlen su sueño es tener su granja más grande.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Marlen, 30, is a single mother of a three-year-old daughter.  She has her own locale and has been working for the last year raising chickens.  She sells her product packed and ready for consumption throughout the region.  Her customers are all the grocery stores and small markets that place orders every two weeks and all the people form the community who come by her house to buy from her.  Her business is located in the community of Espino La Montaña in south Honduras.

Marlen is asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy feed concentrate, vaccines and vitamins for her farm.  With profits and support from this loan Marlen wants to get ahead and continue improving her business and to provide better customer service.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
La señora Lesly  de 36 años de edad,  vive con sus dos hijos  en su casa ubicada en la comunidad de Altos de la Cruz San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante sus clientes son los amigos, familiares y vecinos que ella visita tres veces por semana.
Doña Lesly esta solicitando 5,000.00 para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, ropa de niño y sudaderas. Ya que para esta época se vende bastante este tipo de prendas de vestir. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y de esta manera tener mejores ganancias y mejorar un poco su condición de vida.
Doña Lesly su sueño es crecer en su negocio  y mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Lesly, 36, lives with her two children in a house located in the community of Altos de la Cruz, San Lorenzo, in south Honduras.  For the last three years she’s been in the business of selling used clothes from place to place.  Her customers are friends, family members and neighbors she visits three times a week.

Lesly is requesting a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, children’s clothes and sweatshirts because she sells quite a bit of clothes this season.  With support from the loan she intends to cover her need for business financing to obtain higher profits and improve her living conditions a bit.  Lesly’s dream is to grow in business and do some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC,la socia continua con su negocio de bar ,la socia vende lo que son bebidas como cerveza ,gaseosas,agua entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 4:00pm hasta la 01:00am aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuoatas establecidas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the communal bank HATUN RUMIYOC and continues to run her bar business. She sell beverages such as beer, sodas, water, and more. For years she has managed her business, working from 4:00 p.m. until about 1:00 a.m. She is responsible and hardworking because she must support her family.

Elena is applying for a loan to buy beer for her business. She is grateful for the loan offered and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy beer for her business.

loans.name: Salimu

texts.en: Salimu is a divorced mother of three children. She runs a vegetable stall at the market selling a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables. Salimu is a hard-working and visionary woman who has the urge to move forward. Despite the challenges she is going through, she always has the spirit of overcoming them. She knows that one day she will achieve the goals she has set. Salimu is taking out a loan to invest purchase more fruits and vegetables. She has some plans of opening a clothes-selling business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase of more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sweets like chocolates, lollipops and cookies, among others.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Cienaga Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta es madre soltera, tiene 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica  al bordado de blusas, inicio este negocio siendo operaria para el negocio de una familiar de ella y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia,, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a presta sus servicio de jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que le servirá para la compra de materiales para bordado de blusas, espera en el futuro, tener a varias personas trabajando para su negocio, generando así fuentes de trabajo para otras personas. Las demás integrantes del grupo, se dedican a la crianza de animales, y bordado de blusas.
texts.en:
Marta is a 42-year-old single mother who did not have the chance to go to school. She has four children, three of whom are students. She embroiders blouses, a skill she performed as an operator for a family business, and she now has 20 years of experience. Her husband, a day laborer, helps her.

She is organizing a group to apply for a loan which she will use to buy materials to embroider blouses. She hopes to employ several workers for her business, thereby generating income for others. The other members of the communal bank raise livestock and embroider blouses.

loans.use: To buy cloths to embroider.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Alegre y participativa, así es Felicitas con 42 años de edad lleva consigo varios años de  matrimonio con  Cesario, complementan su alegría familiar sus 5 hijos. Posee una vivienda hecha a base de material noble que logró concretar hace 3 años con ayuda de su esposo. Viendo la buena demanda considerable que presentaban las tiendas de abarrotes y teniendo el deseo de desempeñarse comercialmente, inicio hace 4 años con su negocio , al inicio algo desabastecido pero con lo necesario para proyectar a largo plazo un buen negocio a favor de su clientela. Es así que ambiento en un ambiente de su casa, su tienda, con andamios simples y sin vitrina teniendo que ella sola hacerse cargo durante el día, pero siempre con la motivación de seguir trabajando ya que cumplía hasta ese entonces un objetivo para su familia. Posteriormente y gracias a los préstamos de MFP fue ampliando su negocio hasta volverse uno de los más competentes de su barrio siendo un poquito más rentable con el pasar de los días. ahora con el fin de cumplir con la demanda y el crecimiento comercial, desea comprarse una refrigeradora para ofrecer bebidas heladas y más mercadería para su negocio.
Tiene consigo 15 préstamos con MFP, desde siempre demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos, le es grato pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son un número considerable de socios muy conocidos, generándole esto mucha confianza.
Con los 2,000 realizará la compra de una refrigeradora y demás mercadería para continuar abasteciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Cheerful and participative is how Felicitas, 42, has been married to Cesario for several years; their family joy is compounded by five children.  She has a house made out of substantial materials she managed to acquire three years ago with her husband’s help.  

Seeing the good demand grocery stores had and wanting to become a merchant, she started her business four years ago.  At first she only stocked the bare necessities but her long-range plan was to become well established with her clientele.  This was how she set aside space at home to set up her store with simple shelving and no display case; she tended to it by herself all day but always motivated to continue working because she was reaching for a family goal.  

Later on and thanks to MFP loans she gradually expanded the business until she became one of the most competent in her neighborhood and as time passed more profitable too.  Now, aiming at meeting demand and commercial growth, she wants to buy a refrigerator so she can offer cold beverages and to buy more merchandise for the store.

She’s had 15 MFP loans and always has been punctual and responsible with her payments.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because they are a large number of well-known members which makes her very confident.  She will use the 2,000 to buy a refrigerator and other merchandise to continue stocking the store.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Ericson

texts.es:
Ericson es un hombre de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pareja y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Ericson no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones aprovecha la oportunidad para comer un riquísimo Chilcano de Carachama, el cual es su comida favorita.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Erickson trabaja como obrero en una empresa ladrillera de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Ericson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea comprar materiales de construcción y pagar la mano de obrar para realizar el cercado de su hogar, de esta manera Ericson tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones, adecuadas y seguras, que brinden mayor seguridad para él y su familia, así pues Ericson seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y su sueño de tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ericson is a 38 year old man.  He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his life partner and their three little children.  He loves them, and they are his main reason for living.  He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  He and his life partner devote all of their efforts into getting their family ahead.

Unfortunately, Ericson was not able to study for a professional career in accounting.  Ever since he was very young he had to work to support his parents.  In his free time he likes to take walks on the warm and welcoming streets of his city.  Sometimes he takes advantage of the opportunity to eat the delicious ‘Chilcano de Carachama’ [a fish dish], which is his favorite food. 

Ericson works with a great deal of effort and diligence as a worker in a brick company in his city.  He works every day, and he starts his work in the early morning hours.  He can work approximately 12 hours.  He believes that it is going well for him because of his effort and the kind way he treats his customers.

Ericson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to him he will be able to improve his house.  He wishes to buy construction materials and to pay for labor to build a wall around his house.  This way Ericson’s house will be in better condition.  It will be safe and sound so that it provides him and his family with greater security.  Ericson will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to achieve his goal and his dream of having a business selling groceries.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dining room set and clothing for her children.

loans.name: Yoli Elita

texts.es:
Yoli es una mujer de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus seis hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente es madres soltera, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; Yoli no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yoli trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos y frutas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Yoli se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual utilizara para alquilarla a choferes para que brinden servicios de transporte, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que al lado de su familia pueda lograr su sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Yoli, 43, is a woman living in the city of Pucallpa with her six children who she loves and are her main reason for living.  Sadly, she’s a single mother.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Yoli was unable to study a professional career because she had to start working very young to help out her parents.  In her free time she enjoys cooking a delicious “Lomo Saltado” to share with her family.

With much effort and dedication, Yoli works in her small business selling fruit and beverages.  She starts work very early every day and can work about ten hours daily.  She feels good working and thinks she does well because of the kind way she treats her customers.

Yoli is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a mototaxi that she’ll least out to drivers to provide transportation services and she can continue working and striving so that alongside her family she can reach her dream of seeing her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa, a quien ama y es su fiel compañera, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante; lamentablemente Miguel no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Miguel trabaja como ayudante en una panadería de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8  horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas y sillas, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder acondicionar su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un restaurante grande y reconocido.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old. He lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial with his wife, whom he loves and she is his faithful companion. He is a very friendly person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who devotes all his efforts to getting ahead. Unfortunately, Miguel could not study for a professional career, since he had to work since he was very young in order to support his parents, but he would have liked to.

With a lot of effort and dedication, everyday Miguel works as an assistant in a bakery in his city. He works every day from the early hours in the morning and works for approximately 8 hours. He likes his work and feels that it is going well because of his good performance and because of the kind treatment he gives his customers.

Miguel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help given he can buy tables and chairs, which will be useful outfitting his small business selling food, so he will continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of having a large and well-known restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to outfit his small business selling food

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania,la socia trabaja de forma independiente distribuyendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,a la vez la socia tambien continua dedicandose a tejer chompas de alpaca para su negocio siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de lana de alpaca para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otrgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuoast establecidas.
texts.en:
Hilaria Úrsula is a member of the “HATAN RUMIYOC” communal bank. She still has her business selling crafts. She works independently, distributing her merchandise to the customers that order the most from her. 

At the same time, she has also been knitting alpaca sweaters for her business and this is the way in which she raises her family. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of alpaca wool for her business. 

She feels grateful for the loan being granted and she is committed to making the established payments.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool for her business

loans.name: Rosita 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS 25 DE JULIO”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de calzados, confección de chamarras, taller de costura de overoles, tejido de chompas, tejido de gorras, tejido a macramé, decoración de autos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de decoración de autos que es un negocio familiar y lo emprendieron por iniciativa de su esposo mismo que apoya en la venta.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de accesorios para automóviles) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Rositas 25 de Julio” communal bank will start its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board presided over by Susana.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are blanket weaving, shoe sales, jacket manufacturing, overall sewing shop, sweater knitting, cap knitting, macramé weaving and auto detailing.  The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen.

Susana is one of the members.  She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has an auto detailing business that’s a family business that arose from her and her husband’s joint initiative; he helps her with the sales.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy accessories for cars in stores that sell them at wholesale and then she’ll resell them in her store.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support herself and her family since she’s married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy auto accessories.

loans.name: Armada Boliviana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARMADA BOLIVIANA”  iniciará el decimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nieves es la Presidenta.
